name: not
trans: Not means the opposite or the absence of a particular thing or action.

sentences.english: Most of the stores do not open until 10 am.
sentences.chinese: 大多数商店要到上午10点才开始营业。

sentences.english: She’s not a very nice person.
sentences.chinese: 她为人不太好。

sentences.english: You were wrong not to inform the police.
sentences.chinese: 你没有通知警方是错误的。

sentences.english: ‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘No, not today, dear.’
sentences.chinese: “我们能去公园吗？”“不，今天不行，亲爱的。”

detailed_translations.english: used to make a word, statement, or question negative

name: also
trans: Also means in addition to something or too.

sentences.english: Information is also available on women’s health care.
sentences.chinese: 还可以获得有关女性保健方面的资料。

sentences.english: She sings beautifully and also plays the flute and piano.
sentences.chinese: 她歌唱得好，而且还会吹长笛和弹钢琴。

sentences.english: The system was not only complicated but also ineffective.
sentences.chinese: 这套系统不仅复杂而且效率低。

sentences.english: My girlfriend was also called Helen.
sentences.chinese: 我的女朋友也叫海伦。

detailed_translations.english: in addition to something else that you have mentioned

name: very
trans: Very means to a great extent or degree.

sentences.english: It feels very cold today.
sentences.chinese: 今天很冷。

sentences.english: The fishing industry is very important to the area.
sentences.chinese: 捕鱼业对于该地区非常重要。

sentences.english: The traffic’s moving very slowly this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上车流非常缓慢。

sentences.english: problems that are very similar to mine
sentences.chinese: 和我非常相似的问题

sentences.english: I feel a lot better – thank you very much.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉好多了，非常感谢。

sentences.english: I’m very, very (= used for emphasis ) pleased you can come.
sentences.chinese: 你能来我真是非常高兴。

sentences.english: It’s very kind of you to help.
sentences.chinese: 您来帮忙真是太好了。

sentences.english: My sister and I were married on the very same (= exactly the same ) day.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐在同一天结婚。

sentences.english: He died in this very room.
sentences.chinese: 他就是在这个房间里去世的。

sentences.english: I’ll start at the very beginning.
sentences.chinese: 我要从头开始。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize an adjective, adverb, or phrase
used to emphasize that you are talking exactly about one particular thing or person

name: often
trans: Often means many times or frequently.

sentences.english: She often works at the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 她周末经常要上班。

sentences.english: If you wash your hair too often, it can get too dry.
sentences.chinese: 如果洗头过勤，头发会变得干枯。

sentences.english: How often do you see your parents?
sentences.chinese: 你隔多久去看你父母？

sentences.english: Robin is a difficult child; you’ve said so yourself often enough (= a lot of times ).
sentences.chinese: 罗宾是个难管的孩子，你自己也常常这么说。

detailed_translations.english: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times

name: however
trans: However means on the other hand or nevertheless.

sentences.english: This is a cheap and simple process. However, there are dangers.
sentences.chinese: 这是个花钱少而又简单的方法，不过有危险。

sentences.english: an extremely unpleasant disease that is, however, easy to treat
sentences.chinese: 一种让人极其难受却容易治疗的病

sentences.english: However you look at it, it's going to cost a lot.
sentences.chinese: 不管你怎么看，它都要花很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are adding a fact or piece of information that seems surprising, or seems very different from what you have just said

name: too
trans: Too means also or in addition, and can also indicate an excess or degree of something.

sentences.english: Do you think the music’s too loud?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得音乐太响了吗？

sentences.english: You’ve put too much salt in the soup.
sentences.chinese: 你往汤里放盐太多。

sentences.english: There are too many cars on the road.
sentences.chinese: 路上车辆太多。

detailed_translations.english: more than is acceptable or possible

name: usually
trans: Usually means normally or typically.

sentences.english: Women usually live longer than men.
sentences.chinese: 女人通常比男人长寿。

sentences.english: Usually I wear black, grey, or brown.
sentences.chinese: 通常我都穿黑色、灰色或者棕色的衣服。

sentences.english: The drive usually takes 15 or 20 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 这段车程通常需要 15 或 20 分钟。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about what happens on most occasions or in most situations

name: really
trans: Really means truly or genuinely.

sentences.english: Why don’t you tell us what really happened?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不把真相告诉我们？

sentences.english: Oliver’s not really her brother.
sentences.chinese: 奥利弗其实不是她弟弟。

sentences.english: I never know what he’s really thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我从来都不知道他的真实想法。

sentences.english: She seems unfriendly at first, but she’s really very nice.
sentences.chinese: 一开始她似乎并不友善，但其实她人很好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 真正地， 实际上； 很， 十分， 全然
detailed_translations.english: used when you are talking about what actually happened or is true, rather than what people might wrongly think

name: early
trans: Early means before the usual or expected time.

sentences.english: We arrived early.
sentences.chinese: 我们提早到了。

sentences.english: They must have come home early.
sentences.chinese: 他们肯定提早回到家了。

sentences.english: the early morning sunshine
sentences.chinese: 清晨的阳光

detailed_translations.english: before the usual, arranged, or expected time
in the first part of a period of time, event, or process

name: never
trans: Never means not at any time or not once.

sentences.english: He’s never been to Australia.
sentences.chinese: 他从未去过澳大利亚。

sentences.english: I’m never going back there again, not as long as I live.
sentences.chinese: 只要我活着，我再也不会回到那儿去。

sentences.english: It is never too late to give up smoking.
sentences.chinese: 戒烟不言晚。

sentences.english: (= never after a particular time ) would he return to Naples.
sentences.chinese: 他再也不会回到那不勒斯。

detailed_translations.english: not at any time, or not once

name: always
trans: Always means at all times or on every occasion.

sentences.english: Always lock your bicycle to something secure.
sentences.chinese: 每次都要把自行车锁在牢固的物体上。

sentences.english: She’d always assumed that Gabriel was a girl’s name.
sentences.chinese: 她一直认为加布里埃尔是个女孩名字。

sentences.english: He hadn’t always been a butler.
sentences.chinese: 他并不是一直当管家。

sentences.english: I’ll always remember that day.
sentences.chinese: 我会永远记住那一天。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, at all times, or every time

name: sometimes
trans: Sometimes means occasionally or from time to time.

sentences.english: I sometimes have to work late.
sentences.chinese: 我有时得工作到很晚。

sentences.english: Sometimes, Grandma would tell us stories about her childhood in Italy.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，祖母会跟我们讲讲她儿时在意大利的经历。

sentences.english: ‘Do you ever wish you were back in Japan?’ ‘Sometimes. Not very often.’
sentences.chinese: “你有没有想过希望回到日本？”“有时候吧，但不经常这么想。”

sentences.english: The journey takes an hour, sometimes even longer.
sentences.chinese: 路上需要一小时，有时甚至更长。

detailed_translations.english: on some occasions but not always

name: together
trans: Together means in a group or in a cooperative manner.

sentences.english: We’ve very much enjoyed working together .
sentences.chinese: 我们在一起工作非常开心。

sentences.english: They’ve decided to spend more time together.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定要花更多时间在一起。

sentences.english: He and my father were at school together.
sentences.chinese: 他和我父亲一起上过学。

sentences.english: Together they went back inside the villa.
sentences.chinese: 他们一起回到了别墅里。

detailed_translations.chinese: 一起；同时；相互；连续地；总共
detailed_translations.english: if two or more people do something together, they do it with each other

detailed_translations.chinese: 新潮的；情绪稳定的，做事有效率的

name: likely
trans: Likely means probably or with a high probability.

sentences.english: Snow showers are likely tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天可能有阵雪。

sentences.english: the most likely cause of the problem
sentences.chinese: 造成这个问题最有可能的原因

sentences.english: It is more than likely (= almost certain ) the votes will have to be counted again.
sentences.chinese: 选票很有可能要重新点算。

sentences.english: It could have been an accident, but that was hardly likely (= not very likely ).
sentences.chinese: 这有可能是意外事故，但可能性不大。

sentences.english: I’d very likely have done the same thing in your situation.
sentences.chinese: 我要是处在你这种情况，也很有可能会那样做的。

detailed_translations.english: something that is likely will probably happen or is probably true
probably

name: simply
trans: Simply means in a plain or straightforward manner.

sentences.english: Try to express yourself more simply.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把你的意思表达得更简单明了。

sentences.english: To put it simply, the tax cuts mean the average person will be about 3% better off.
sentences.chinese: 简单地说，这次减税意味着普通人的收入将增加 3% 左右。

sentences.english: We had to live very simply on my father’s small salary.
sentences.chinese: 我们只能靠父亲微薄的工资过着非常简朴的生活。

detailed_translations.english: if you say or explain something simply, you say it in a way that is easy for people to understand

name: generally
trans: Generally means usually or commonly.

sentences.english: Generally speaking, the more expensive the stereo, the better it is.
sentences.chinese: 一般说来，立体声音响越贵的越好。

detailed_translations.english: used to introduce a statement that is true in most cases but not always

name: instead
trans: Instead means as an alternative or substitute.

sentences.english: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.chinese: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

sentences.english: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
sentences.chinese: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？

sentences.english: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
sentences.chinese: 他没有生气，反而似乎很高兴。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc

name: actually
trans: Actually means in reality or in fact.

sentences.english: I’ve known Barbara for years. Since we were babies, actually.
sentences.chinese: 我认识芭芭拉很多年了，实际上我们从小就认识。

sentences.english: Actually, on second thoughts, I don’t think I want to go out tonight.
sentences.chinese: 其实再想想，我今晚不打算出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add new information to what you have just said, to give your opinion, or to start a new conversation

name: again
trans: Again means once more or another time.

sentences.english: Can you say that again? I didn’t hear.
sentences.chinese: 你能再说一遍吗？ 我没听见。

sentences.english: I’ll never go there again.
sentences.chinese: 我再也不会去那儿了。

sentences.english: Mr Khan’s busy. Can you try again later?
sentences.chinese: 卡恩先生正忙着。 你能不能过一会儿再打来？

sentences.english: In 1997, the family moved house yet again.
sentences.chinese: 1997年，全家人再一次搬家。

sentences.english: And again, these workshops will benefit the community widely.
sentences.chinese: 再说，这些工作坊会令社区很多人受惠。

detailed_translations.english: one more time – used when something has happened or been done before

name: rather
trans: Rather means to a certain extent or degree.

sentences.english: I grew up in rather unusual circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我在相当不寻常的环境中长大。

sentences.english: I'm afraid it's a rather long story.
sentences.chinese: 我恐怕这是个相当长的故事。

sentences.english: I’d rather have a quiet night in front of the TV.
sentences.chinese: 我宁愿晚上安安静静地看看电视。

detailed_translations.english: fairly or to some degree

name: almost
trans: Almost means nearly or just about.

sentences.english: Have you almost finished?
sentences.chinese: 你差不多完成了吗？

sentences.english: Supper’s almost ready.
sentences.chinese: 晚饭就要做好了。

sentences.english: It was almost midnight.
sentences.chinese: 午夜将至。

sentences.english: Almost nothing was done to improve the situation.
sentences.chinese: 几乎没有采取什么措施来改善这个情况。

sentences.english: The story is almost certainly true.
sentences.chinese: 这故事几乎肯定是真实的。

sentences.english: He’s almost as old as I am.
sentences.chinese: 他差不多跟我一样大。

detailed_translations.english: nearly, but not completely or not quite

name: especially
trans: Especially means particularly or notably.

sentences.english: I never liked long walks, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 我向来不喜欢长距离散步，尤其在冬天。

sentences.english: Art books are expensive to produce, especially if they contain colour illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 美术类书籍制作成本很高，尤其是那些带彩色插图的。

sentences.english: I was especially fond of chocolate biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我特别爱吃巧克力饼干。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others

name: ever
trans: Ever means at any time or in the course of one's life.

sentences.english: Nothing ever seems to upset him.
sentences.chinese: 似乎从来没有什么事情会使他烦恼。

sentences.english: Have you ever been to Paris?
sentences.chinese: 你去过巴黎吗？

sentences.english: I don’t think I’ve ever been here before.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得我以前从未到过这里。

sentences.english: It was raining harder than ever.
sentences.chinese: 当时下着前所未有的大雨。

detailed_translations.english: used in negative sentences and questions, or sentences with if to mean ‘at any time’

name: quickly
trans: Quickly means in a rapid or speedy manner.

sentences.english: We need to get this finished as quickly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须尽快完成此事。

sentences.english: Kids grow up so quickly these days.
sentences.chinese: 现在的孩子长得真快啊。

detailed_translations.english: fast

name: probably
trans: Probably means likely or with a high probability.

sentences.english: It'll probably be OK.
sentences.chinese: 这大概没有问题。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that sth is likely to happen or to be true

name: already
trans: Already means by this time or before the present time.

sentences.english: ‘Lunch? ’ ‘No thanks, I've already eaten. ’
sentences.chinese: “午餐？”“不，谢谢，我已吃过了。”

sentences.english: We got there early but Mike had already left.
sentences.chinese: 我们及早到了那里，但是迈克已经离开了。

detailed_translations.english: before now or before a particular time in the pas

name: below
trans: Below means lower or beneath.

sentences.english: an animal that lives below ground
sentences.chinese: 生活在地下的动物

sentences.english: Water was dripping onto the floor below.
sentences.chinese: 水滴到下面的地板上。

sentences.english: I could hear voices in the courtyard below my window.
sentences.chinese: 我能听到院子里有人在我的窗下说话。

sentences.english: They camped a few hundred feet below the summit.
sentences.chinese: 他们在山峰下面几百英尺的地方扎了营。

sentences.english: Down below, people were talking and laughing.
sentences.chinese: 下面，人们谈笑风生。

sentences.english: Somewhere far below, a door slammed.
sentences.chinese: 下面远远的什么地方有一扇门砰地关上了。

sentences.english: The kitchen is directly below her bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 厨房就在她卧室的正下方。

sentences.english: Captain Parker went below (=  to the lower level of the ship  ) , leaving Clooney in charge.
sentences.chinese: 帕克船长下去了，让克卢尼掌舵。

detailed_translations.chinese: 在下面，在较低处；在本页下面
detailed_translations.english: in a lower place or position, or on a lower level

name: directly
trans: Directly means immediately or straight.

sentences.english: The new property tax law won’t directly affect us.
sentences.chinese: 新的财产税法不会直接影响到我们。

sentences.english: We hope to bring together the countries directly involved in the conflict.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望让直接卷入冲突的各国重归于好。

sentences.english: Most guests left directly after the wake.
sentences.chinese: 守灵仪式一结束，大部分客人就立刻走了。

detailed_translations.english: with no other person, action, process etc between

name: therefore
trans: Therefore means as a result or consequently.

sentences.english: Their car was bigger and therefore more comfortable.
sentences.chinese: 他们的车大些，所以更舒适些。

sentences.english: Progress so far has been very good. We are, therefore, confident that the work will be completed on time.
sentences.chinese: 到目前为止进展十分顺利，所以我们有把握按时完成工作。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that has just been mentioned

name: else
trans: Else means otherwise or in addition to.

sentences.english: There’s something else I’d like to talk about as well.
sentences.chinese: 我还有其他事情要谈一谈。

sentences.english: I’d like you to come, and anyone else who’s free.
sentences.chinese: 我想请你过来，其他人有空也可以来。

sentences.english: He was awake now, as was everyone else.
sentences.chinese: 他现在已经醒了，其他人也都醒了。

sentences.english: Who else was at the party?
sentences.chinese: 还有谁参加了聚会？

sentences.english: ‘Two coffees, please.’ ‘Anything else?’ ‘No, thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “请来两杯咖啡。”“还要别的吗？”“不要了，谢谢。

sentences.english: (= more than any other things ) she was seeking love.
sentences.chinese: 她追求爱情胜过一切。

sentences.english: If I can't make a living at painting, at least I can teach someone else to paint.
sentences.chinese: 如果我不能以画画谋生的话，至少我能教别人画画。

sentences.english: We had nothing else to do on those long trips.
sentences.chinese: 在那些漫长的旅途中我们别无他事可做。

detailed_translations.english: besides or in addition to someone or something
You use else after words such as "anywhere," "someone," and "what" to refer in a vague way to another person, place, or thing

name: thus
trans: Thus means in this way or as a result of this.

sentences.english: Most of the evidence was destroyed in the fire. Thus it would be almost impossible to prove him guilty.
sentences.chinese: 大多数证据已在大火中烧毁，因而要证明他有罪几乎是不可能的。

detailed_translations.english: as a result of something that you have just mentioned

name: easily
trans: Easily means with ease or without difficulty.

sentences.english: They won quite easily.
sentences.chinese: 他们赢得相当轻松。

sentences.english: We found the house easily enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们轻轻松松就找到了房子。

detailed_translations.english: without problems or difficulties

name: eventually
trans: Eventually means in the end or finally.

sentences.english: He eventually escaped and made his way back to England.
sentences.chinese: 他终于逃脱并返回英格兰。

sentences.english: Eventually, she got a job and moved to London.
sentences.chinese: 最终，她找到了工作并移居伦敦。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time, or after a lot of things have happened

name: exactly
trans: Exactly means precisely or accurately.

sentences.english: It’s exactly half past five.
sentences.chinese: 一分不差，正好5点半。

sentences.english: The figures may not be exactly right, but they’re close enough.
sentences.chinese: 那些数字可能不是非常精确，但也相当接近。

sentences.english: That’s exactly what we’ve been trying to tell you.
sentences.chinese: 那正是我们一直想告诉你的。

detailed_translations.english: used when emphasizing that something is no more and no less than a number or amount, or is completely correct in every detail

name: certainly
trans: Certainly means without doubt or surely.

sentences.english: They’re certainly not mine.
sentences.chinese: “请给我来杯啤酒。”“好的，先生。”

sentences.english: ‘I’d like a beer, please.’ ‘Certainly, sir.’
sentences.chinese: “请给我来杯啤酒。”“好的，先生。”

sentences.english: ‘Can I come along?’ ‘Certainly.’
sentences.chinese: “我可以一起去吗？”“当然可以。”

detailed_translations.english: without doubt

name: normally
trans: Normally means typically or usually.

sentences.english: The journey normally takes about two hours.
sentences.chinese: 这段旅程通常需要大约两小时。

sentences.english: Normally, I park behind the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 通常我把车停在剧院后面。

sentences.english: The system seems to be working normally now.
sentences.chinese: 目前该系统似乎运行正常。

detailed_translations.english: usually

name: currently
trans: Currently means at the present time or now.

sentences.english: the products that are currently available
sentences.chinese: 目前供应的产品

sentences.english: He is currently working on his first novel.
sentences.chinese: 他目前正在创作他的第一本小说。

detailed_translations.english: at the present time

name: extremely
trans: Extremely means to a great extent or degree.

sentences.english: Earthquakes are extremely difficult to predict.
sentences.chinese: 地震非常难以预测。

sentences.english: I’m extremely sorry to have troubled you.
sentences.chinese: 给你添了麻烦，我十分抱歉。

detailed_translations.english: to a very great degree

name: finally
trans: Finally means at last or in the end.

sentences.english: After several delays we finally took off at six o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 几经耽搁后，我们终于在六点起飞了。

sentences.english: Finally, Karpov cracked under the pressure.
sentences.chinese: 最后，卡尔波夫承受不住压力崩溃了。

detailed_translations.english: after a long time

name: constantly
trans: Constantly means continuously or always.

sentences.english: He talked constantly about his work.
sentences.chinese: 他不断地谈到他的工作。

sentences.english: The English language is constantly changing .
sentences.chinese: 英语在不断地变化。

detailed_translations.english: all the time, or very often

name: properly
trans: Properly means correctly or in the appropriate manner.

sentences.english: The brakes don’t seem to be working properly.
sentences.chinese: 刹车似乎不正常。

sentences.english: Then he’s not doing his job properly.
sentences.chinese: 那么他没把分内事做好。

sentences.english: Parents should teach their children to behave properly in public.
sentences.chinese: 家长应该教导子女在公共场合要有规有矩。

sentences.english: properly trained staff
sentences.chinese: 训练有素的员工

detailed_translations.english: correctly, or in a way that is considered right

name: soon
trans: Soon means in a short time or shortly.

sentences.english: It will be dark soon.
sentences.chinese: 天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: David arrived sooner than I expected.
sentences.chinese: 戴维到得比我预料的快。

sentences.english: ‘Who?’ ‘You’ll find out soon enough (= fairly soon ) .’
sentences.chinese: “谁？”“你很快就会知道的。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 快；不久，一会儿；立刻；宁愿
detailed_translations.english: in a short time from now, or a short time after something else happens

name: specifically
trans: Specifically means in a precise or detailed manner.

sentences.english: advertising that specifically targets children
sentences.chinese: 专门针对儿童的广告

detailed_translations.chinese: 特别地， 特定地； 明确地， 具体地
detailed_translations.english: relating to or intended for one particular type of person or thing only

name: ahead
trans: Ahead means in front or before.

sentences.english: He kept his gaze fixed on the car ahead.
sentences.chinese: 他的目光一直盯着前面的那辆汽车。

sentences.english: We could see the lights of Las Vegas up ahead .
sentences.chinese: 我们能看到前方拉斯维加斯的灯光。

sentences.english: Henry hurried on ahead.
sentences.chinese: 亨利赶紧跑到前面。

sentences.english: The party was planned weeks ahead.
sentences.chinese: 聚会提前几个星期就已筹划好了。

detailed_translations.english: further forward in space or time; in front

name: daily
trans: Daily means occurring every day or on a daily basis.

sentences.english: daily flights to Miami
sentences.chinese: 每日飞往迈阿密的航班

sentences.english: China Daily receives dispatches from all parts of the world.
sentences.chinese: 《中国日报》收到世界各地发来的电讯。

detailed_translations.english: happening or done every day
a newspaper that is printed and sold every day, or every day except Sunday

name: highly
trans: Highly means to a great degree or extent.

sentences.english: Tom’s mother was highly critical of the school’s approach.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆的母亲对学校的处理方法持强烈的批评态度。

sentences.english: highly competitive industries
sentences.chinese: 竞争非常激烈的行业

sentences.english: a highly desirable neighborhood
sentences.chinese: 宜居的街区

sentences.english: T.S. Eliot’s highly influential poem, ‘The Waste Land’ T.S.
sentences.chinese: 艾略特极有影响力的诗作《荒原》

sentences.english: a highly developed economy
sentences.chinese: 高度发达的经济

detailed_translations.english: very

name: immediately
trans: Immediately means instantly or without delay.

sentences.english: He retired immediately after the end of the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争一结束他就退休了。

sentences.english: Those most immediately involved in the disaster will be given support.
sentences.chinese: 灾害最直接受害者将获得援助。

detailed_translations.english: very soon before or after something

name: relatively
trans: Relatively means comparatively or to a certain extent.

sentences.english: The system is relatively easy to use.
sentences.chinese: 这个系统使用起来相对容易。

sentences.english: E-commerce is a relatively recent phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 电子商务相对而言是新兴事物。

detailed_translations.english: something that is relatively small, easy etc is fairly small, easy etc compared to other things

name: slowly
trans: Slowly means at a low speed or pace.

sentences.english: He shook his head slowly.
sentences.chinese: 他慢慢地摇了摇头。

sentences.english: ‘That’s true,’ said Joe slowly.
sentences.chinese: “没错。”乔慢吞吞地说道。

detailed_translations.english: at a slow speed

name: fairly
trans: Fairly means in a just or impartial manner.

sentences.english: The house had a fairly large garden.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子有个不小的花园。

sentences.english: She speaks English fairly well.
sentences.chinese: 她英语讲得还不错。

sentences.english: I felt I hadn’t been treated fairly.
sentences.chinese: 我感到自己没有受到公正对待。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little, but much less than very

name: primarily
trans: Primarily means mainly or principally.

sentences.english: The advertisement is aimed primarily at children.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告的对象主要是儿童。

detailed_translations.english: mainly

name: completely
trans: Completely means entirely or fully.

sentences.english: I completely forgot that it’s his birthday today.
sentences.chinese: 我完全忘了今天是他的生日。

sentences.english: He had never completely recovered from his illness.
sentences.chinese: 他病后一直没有完全康复。

sentences.english: a completely new range of low-cost computers
sentences.chinese: 全新的低价电脑系列

sentences.english: I’m not completely sure.
sentences.chinese: 我不能十分肯定。

sentences.english: Portuguese is pronounced completely differently from Spanish.
sentences.chinese: 葡萄牙语的发音和西班牙语的完全不同。

detailed_translations.english: to the greatest degree possible

name: ultimately
trans: Ultimately means finally or in the end.

sentences.english: Ultimately, the decision rests with the child’s parents.
sentences.chinese: 最终，决定权在这孩子的父母手中。

sentences.english: a long but ultimately successful campaign
sentences.chinese: 一场历时很久但最终成功的运动

detailed_translations.english: finally, after everything else has been done or considered

name: widely
trans: Widely means extensively or broadly.

sentences.english: The quality of the applicants varies widely.
sentences.chinese: 申请人的素质差异很大。

detailed_translations.english: to a large degree – used when talking about differences

name: recently
trans: Recently means in the recent past or lately.

sentences.english: He has recently been promoted to Assistant Manager.
sentences.chinese: 他最近晋升为经理助理。

sentences.english: a recently published biography
sentences.chinese: 一部最近出版的传记

sentences.english: Jerry lived in Cairo until quite recently .
sentences.chinese: 直至不久之前杰里一直住在开罗。

sentences.english: More recently, he’s appeared in a number of British films.
sentences.chinese: 最近，他出演了多部英国电影。

detailed_translations.english: not long ago

name: seriously
trans: Seriously means in a serious manner or with sincerity.

sentences.english: Something was seriously wrong .
sentences.chinese: 出大问题了。

sentences.english: It’s time we talked seriously about our relationship.
sentences.chinese: 我们该认真谈一谈我们的关系了。

detailed_translations.english: very much or to a great degree

name: frequently
trans: Frequently means often or repeatedly.

sentences.english: He was frequently drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他经常喝醉。

detailed_translations.english: very often or many times

name: fully
trans: Fully means completely or entirely.

sentences.english: The restaurant is fully booked this evening.
sentences.chinese: 今晚这家餐厅订满了。

sentences.english: Elisa has not fully recovered from the incident.
sentences.chinese: 埃莉莎还没有完全从这个事件中恢复过来。

sentences.english: I am fully aware of your problems.
sentences.chinese: 你的问题我全知道。

sentences.english: The changes in policy are fully described in the review.
sentences.chinese: 政策的变化在报告中有全面的描述。

sentences.english: I fully accept that what he says is true.
sentences.chinese: 我完全同意，他的话属实。

sentences.english: This concept is discussed more fully in Chapter 9.
sentences.chinese: 这一概念在第九章中有更详细的论述。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: mostly
trans: Mostly means mainly or for the most part.

sentences.english: Green teas are mostly from China or Japan.
sentences.chinese: 绿茶主要来自中国或日本。

sentences.english: There were about fifteen people in the lounge, mostly women.
sentences.chinese: 大厅里大约有15人，大部分是女性。

sentences.english: He blamed his parents. Mostly he blamed his dad.
sentences.chinese: 他责怪他的父母，主要是责怪他爸爸。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about most members of a group, most occasions, most parts of something etc

name: naturally
trans: Naturally means in a natural way or without any artificial influence.

sentences.english: After a while, we naturally started talking about the children.
sentences.chinese: 过了一会儿，我们自然而然地谈起了孩子。

sentences.english: naturally occurring chemicals
sentences.chinese: 天然存在的化学物质

detailed_translations.english: in a way that you would expect

name: nearly
trans: Nearly means almost or close to.

sentences.english: It took nearly two hours to get here.
sentences.chinese: 到这里花了将近两小时。

sentences.english: Michelle’s nearly twenty.
sentences.chinese: 米歇尔年近二十。

sentences.english: Is the job nearly finished?
sentences.chinese: 这工作快干完了吗？

sentences.english: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
sentences.chinese: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。

sentences.english: I nearly always go home for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。

sentences.english: He very nearly died.
sentences.chinese: 他差点送命。

detailed_translations.english: almost, but not quite or not completely

name: occasionally
trans: Occasionally means sometimes or from time to time.

sentences.english: Occasionally Alice would look up from her books.
sentences.chinese: 艾丽斯偶尔会从书中抬起头来。

name: carefully
trans: Carefully means with care or caution.

sentences.english: He folded the sheets up carefully.
sentences.chinese: 他把床单仔细地叠好。

detailed_translations.english: in a careful way

name: clearly
trans: Clearly means in a clear or obvious way.

sentences.english: Please speak clearly.
sentences.chinese: 请说得清楚点。

sentences.english: The economy was clearly failing.
sentences.chinese: 经济很明显在走下坡路。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is easy to see, hear, or understand

name: essentially
trans: Essentially means basically or fundamentally.

sentences.english: Ballet is essentially a middle-class interest.
sentences.chinese: 芭蕾舞基本上是中产阶级感兴趣的东西。

sentences.english: Suicide rates have remained essentially unchanged.
sentences.chinese: 自杀率基本上保持不变。

sentences.english: Essentially, we are talking about the cold war period.
sentences.chinese: 我们基本上是在谈论冷战时期。

detailed_translations.english: used when stating the most basic facts about something

name: possibly
trans: Possibly means maybe or perhaps.

sentences.english: This last task is possibly the most difficult.
sentences.chinese: 这最后一项任务也许是最难的。

sentences.english: It will take three weeks, possibly longer.
sentences.chinese: 要花三个星期，也许更久。

sentences.english: ‘Will you be here tomorrow?’ ‘Possibly.’
sentences.chinese: “你明天到这儿来吗？”“也许吧。”

sentences.english: ‘Was it murder?’ ‘ Quite possibly (= it is very likely ) .’
sentences.chinese: “是谋杀吗？”“很可能是。”

detailed_translations.english: used when saying that something may be true or likely, although you are not completely certain

name: slightly
trans: Slightly means to a small degree or in a minor way.

sentences.english: His family then moved to a slightly larger house.
sentences.chinese: 他的家后来搬到了一间稍微大一点儿的房子。

sentences.english: Each person learns in a slightly different way.
sentences.chinese: 每个人学习的方式都略有不同。

detailed_translations.english: Slightly means to some degree but not to a very large degree

name: somewhat
trans: Somewhat means to some extent or in a moderate way.

sentences.english: Things have changed somewhat since then.
sentences.chinese: 从那时候起，情况就有些不一样了。

detailed_translations.english: more than a little but not very

name: equally
trans: Equally means to an equal degree or in a balanced way.

sentences.english: You must have a good education, but practical training is equally important.
sentences.chinese: 你必须接受良好的教育，不过实际培训也同样重要。

detailed_translations.chinese: 同样地；相等地，平等地；公平地
detailed_translations.english: to the same degree or amount

name: greatly
trans: Greatly means to a large extent or significantly.

sentences.english: All offers of help will be greatly appreciated .
sentences.chinese: 如蒙帮助，感激不尽。

sentences.english: The quality of health care varies greatly .
sentences.chinese: 医疗保健服务质量差别很大。

detailed_translations.english: extremely or very much

name: necessarily
trans: Necessarily means inevitably or as a logical consequence.

sentences.english: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
sentences.chinese: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided

name: personally
trans: Personally means in a personal or individual manner.

sentences.english: The managing director wrote personally to thank me.
sentences.chinese: 总经理亲自写信向我表示感谢。

sentences.english: All important work is personally approved by him.
sentences.chinese: 所有重要的工作都由他亲自批准。

sentences.english: I’ll see to it personally.
sentences.chinese: 这件事我要亲自处理。

detailed_translations.chinese: 亲自地；当面；个别地；就自己而言
detailed_translations.english: if you do something personally, you do it yourself rather than getting someone else to do it

name: rarely
trans: Rarely means seldom or infrequently.

sentences.english: We rarely see someone go after the health area.
sentences.chinese: 我们很少见到有人在健康领域做文章。

sentences.english: He rarely mingles with other students on the campus.
sentences.chinese: 他很少和校园里的其他学生交往。

name: regularly
trans: Regularly means habitually or on a consistent basis.

sentences.english: We meet regularly, once a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们定期见面，每月一次。

detailed_translations.english: at the same time each day, week, month etc

name: similarly
trans: Similarly means in a similar way or manner.

sentences.english: The first letter she wrote me was less than a page long, and her second letter was similarly brief.
sentences.chinese: 她写给我的第一封信不到一页，第二封信也一样简短。

sentences.english: The cost of food and clothing has come down in recent years. Similarly, fuel prices have fallen quite considerably.
sentences.chinese: 吃穿的费用近年来下降了。 同样地，燃料价格也有大幅 回落。

detailed_translations.english: in a similar way

name: basically
trans: Basically means fundamentally or essentially.

sentences.english: Basically, I’m just lazy.
sentences.chinese: 说穿了，我就是懒。

sentences.english: Well, basically, it’s a matter of filling in a few forms.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，其实也就是填几张表的事。

sentences.english: I used to see him every night, basically.
sentences.chinese: 基本上，我以前每天晚上都见他。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize the most important reason or fact about something, or a simple explanation of something

name: closely
trans: Closely means intimately or with close attention.

sentences.english: The successful applicant will be working closely with our international staff.
sentences.chinese: 被录用者将与我们的国际员工紧密合作。

sentences.english: lightning, followed closely by thunder
sentences.chinese: 闪电，紧跟着是雷鸣

sentences.english: We were so closely packed in the elevator I could hardly move.
sentences.chinese: 电梯里人挨着人，我几乎动弹不得。

detailed_translations.english: to a very great degree

name: effectively
trans: Effectively means in an effective or successful way.

sentences.english: Children have to learn to communicate effectively.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子应该学会有效地沟通。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that produces the result that was intended

name: initially
trans: Initially means at first or initially.

sentences.english: Stan initially wanted to go to medical school.
sentences.chinese: 斯坦最初想进医学院。

sentences.english: Initially, I thought I would only stay there a year.
sentences.chinese: 起初，我以为我只会在那儿待一年。

detailed_translations.english: at the beginning

name: literally
trans: Literally means actually or in a literal sense.

sentences.english: The name of the cheese is Dolcelatte, literally meaning ‘sweet milk’.
sentences.chinese: 这种奶酪名叫Dolcelatte，字面意思是 “甜牛奶” 。

sentences.english: I said I felt like quitting, but I didn’t mean it literally (= I did not mean exactly what I said )!
sentences.chinese: 我是说我不想干了，但并不是真的不干了！

detailed_translations.english: according to the most basic or original meaning of a word or expression

name: mainly
trans: Mainly means primarily or chiefly.

sentences.english: Her illness was caused mainly by stress.
sentences.chinese: 她的病主要是由精神压力引起的。

sentences.english: The workforce is mainly made up of women.
sentences.chinese: 员工主要是女性。

sentences.english: I don’t go out much, mainly because I have to look after the kids.
sentences.chinese: 我不大出去，主要是因为我得照看孩子们。

sentences.english: Increased sales during the summer were mainly due to tourism.
sentences.chinese: 夏季销售额增加主要是由旅游业带动的。

sentences.english: We talked about various things – work, mainly.
sentences.chinese: 我们谈了各种各样的事情——主要是谈工作。

detailed_translations.english: used to mention the main part or cause of something, the main reason for something etc

name: merely
trans: Merely means only or just.

sentences.english: He’s merely a boy – you can’t expect him to understand.
sentences.chinese: 他只是个孩子——你不要指望他能理解。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how small or unimportant something or someone is

name: gently
trans: Gently means in a gentle or mild way.

sentences.english: ‘You go back to bed now,’ he said gently.
sentences.chinese: “你回去睡觉吧。”他温柔地说道。

sentences.english: She kissed me gently on the cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她温柔地亲吻我的脸颊。

sentences.english: Gently cook the peppers for 10-15 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 用文火将辣椒煮10到15分钟。

sentences.english: Rain pattered gently on the roof above.
sentences.chinese: 雨点轻轻拍打着上面的屋顶。

sentences.english: The road curved gently upwards.
sentences.chinese: 路缓缓地蜿蜒而上。

detailed_translations.english: in a gentle way

name: hopefully
trans: Hopefully means with hope or optimism.

name: originally
trans: Originally means initially or from the beginning.

sentences.english: The family originally came from France.
sentences.chinese: 这个家族最初来自法国。

sentences.english: The building was originally used as a prison.
sentences.chinese: 这幢建筑最初用作监狱。

sentences.english: We originally intended to stay for just a few days.
sentences.chinese: 我们原先打算只逗留几天。

sentences.english: Originally, we had planned a tour of Scotland but we didn’t go in the end.
sentences.chinese: 起先我们计划到苏格兰旅游，但最后没有成行。

detailed_translations.english: in the beginning, before other things happened or before other things changed

name: roughly
trans: Roughly means approximately or roughly.

sentences.english: There were roughly 200 people there.
sentences.chinese: 那儿大约有200人。

sentences.english: Azaleas flower at roughly the same time each year.
sentences.chinese: 杜鹃花每年的开花时间大致相同。

detailed_translations.english: not exactly

name: significantly
trans: Significantly means in a significant or important way.

sentences.english: The Democrats, significantly, finished well behind the Green Party.
sentences.chinese: 值得注意的是，民主党的得票数远远落后于绿党。

detailed_translations.chinese: 意味深长地，值得注目地
detailed_translations.english: used to say that something is very important

name: totally
trans: Totally means completely or entirely.

sentences.english: That’s a totally different matter.
sentences.chinese: 那完全是两码事。

sentences.english: It’s like learning a totally new language.
sentences.chinese: 这像是在学一门全新的语言。

sentences.english: I totally agree.
sentences.chinese: 我完全同意。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: twice
trans: Twice means two times or twice as much.

sentences.english: He was questioned by police twice yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他昨天被警察审问了两次。

sentences.english: None of our dinner menus are exactly the same twice over .
sentences.chinese: 我们的晚餐菜单从没有完全重样的。

detailed_translations.english: two times

name: elsewhere
trans: Elsewhere means in another place or elsewhere.

sentences.english: She is becoming famous in Australia and elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 她在澳大利亚和其他地方渐渐出名了。

sentences.english: Kerala has less crime and alcoholism than elsewhere in India.
sentences.chinese: 喀拉拉邦的犯罪和酗酒现象少于印度的其他地区。

detailed_translations.english: in, at, or to another place

name: everywhere
trans: Everywhere means in all places or everywhere.

sentences.english: I’ve looked everywhere but I can’t find the map.
sentences.chinese: 我到处都找过了，但就是找不到地图。

sentences.english: He’s travelled everywhere in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 他走遍了欧洲各地。

sentences.english: The south should remain dry, but everywhere else will have heavy rain.
sentences.chinese: 南部持续干旱，但其他地区会下暴雨。

detailed_translations.english: in or to every place

name: obviously
trans: Obviously means clearly or obviously.

sentences.english: We’re obviously going to need more help.
sentences.chinese: 显然我们将需要更多的帮助。

sentences.english: Your research has obviously been very thorough.
sentences.chinese: 你的研究工作显然做得很透彻。

sentences.english: Obviously, this is going to take some time.
sentences.chinese: 很明显，这要花点时间。

sentences.english: Cost is obviously important.
sentences.chinese: 费用当然很重要。

sentences.english: She frowned and was obviously puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 她皱起眉头，显然感到不解。

detailed_translations.english: used to mean that a fact can easily be noticed or understood

name: perfectly
trans: Perfectly means in a perfect or flawless way.

sentences.english: It’s perfectly normal to be nervous before a performance.
sentences.chinese: 演出之前觉得紧张再正常不过了。

sentences.english: The sale was perfectly legal.
sentences.chinese: 这笔生意完全合法。

sentences.english: You can get a perfectly good coat at Sears for a lot less money.
sentences.chinese: 你可以少花很多钱在西尔斯百货商店买到一件非常好的外套。

detailed_translations.english: completely – used to emphasize what you are saying

name: physically
trans: Physically means in a physical or bodily way.

sentences.english: She is young and physically fit.
sentences.chinese: 她年轻而且身体健康。

sentences.english: Do you find him physically attractive?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得他长得帅吗？

sentences.english: I felt physically sick at the thought.
sentences.chinese: 一想到那个我就觉得身体不舒服。

sentences.english: children who have been physically abused
sentences.chinese: 身体受到虐待的儿童

detailed_translations.english: in relation to your body rather than your mind or emotions

name: successfully
trans: Successfully means in a successful or effective way.

name: suddenly
trans: Suddenly means suddenly or abruptly.

sentences.english: I suddenly realized that there was someone following me.
sentences.chinese: 我突然意识到有人跟着我。

sentences.english: George died very suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 乔治死得非常突然。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the eagle opened its wings.
sentences.chinese: 突然，鹰展开翅膀。

detailed_translations.english: quickly and unexpectedly

name: truly
trans: Truly means truly or sincerely.

sentences.english: His work is truly original.
sentences.chinese: 他的作品确实十分独特。

sentences.english: Fawcett was a truly remarkable man.
sentences.chinese: 福西特是一位真正不同凡响的人。

sentences.english: a truly great work of medieval literature
sentences.chinese: 一部真正伟大的中世纪文学作品

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that the way you are describing something is really true

name: virtually
trans: Virtually means almost or nearly.

sentences.english: Virtually all the children come to school by bus.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的孩子都乘公交车上学。

sentences.english: He was virtually unknown before running for office.
sentences.chinese: 他在参加竞选之前几乎不为人知。

detailed_translations.english: almost

name: altogether
trans: Altogether means completely or entirely.

sentences.english: an old custom that has vanished altogether
sentences.chinese: 一个彻底消亡的古老习俗

sentences.english: Congress could ban the procession altogether.
sentences.chinese: 国会可以完全禁止这次游行。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something has been done completely or has finished completely
not wearing any clothes – used humorously

name: anyway
trans: Anyway means regardless or in any case.

sentences.english: I know I'll be confronted with difficulties, but I will squeak by anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我会遇到许多困难，可我无论如何总能应付过去。

detailed_translations.english: used to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous statement

name: automatically
trans: Automatically means in a way that is done without conscious thought or effort.

sentences.english: Join now and you will automatically receive 50% off your first purchase.
sentences.chinese: 现在加入，立即享受首次购物五折优惠。

detailed_translations.english: as the result of a situation or action, and without you having to do anything more

name: deeply
trans: Deeply means to an intense or extreme degree.

sentences.english: Her lies hurt my father deeply.
sentences.chinese: 她的谎言深深地伤害了我父亲。

detailed_translations.english: a long way into something

name: definitely
trans: Definitely means without doubt, for sure.

sentences.english: ‘Do you reckon Margot will be there?’ ‘ Definitely not .’
sentences.chinese: “你估计玛戈会在那里吗？” “肯定不会。”

sentences.english: The hotel fitness centre is definitely worth a visit.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店的健身中心绝对值得一去。

sentences.english: I definitely need a holiday.
sentences.chinese: 我太需要休假了。

detailed_translations.english: without any doubt

name: deliberately
trans: Deliberately means done consciously and intentionally.

sentences.english: He deliberately upset her.
sentences.chinese: 他故意惹她不开心。

sentences.english: He shook his head slowly and deliberately.
sentences.chinese: 他缓缓而慎重地摇摇头。

detailed_translations.english: done in a way that is intended or planned

name: hardly
trans: Hardly means barely or almost not at all.

sentences.english: My parents divorced when I was six, and I hardly knew my father.
sentences.chinese: 我六岁时父母离婚，我对父亲几乎一无所知。

sentences.english: The children were so excited they could hardly speak.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们兴奋得几乎连话都说不出来了。

sentences.english: I can hardly believe it.
sentences.chinese: 这简直让我难以置信。

sentences.english: (= almost no one ) writes to me these days.
sentences.chinese: 如今几乎没有人给我写信了。

sentences.english: Dad ate hardly anything (= almost nothing ).
sentences.chinese: 爸爸几乎没吃什么东西。

sentences.english: There was hardly any (= very little ) traffic.
sentences.chinese: 路上车少人稀。

sentences.english: She lives in Spain, so we hardly ever (= almost never ) see her.
sentences.chinese: 她住在西班牙，所以我们几乎见不到她。

detailed_translations.english: almost not

name: readily
trans: Readily means easily and without hesitation.

sentences.english: Boats are readily available to visitors.
sentences.chinese: 游客可以很方便地租到船只。

sentences.english: The information is readily accessible on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 这些信息在因特网上一查就能找到。

detailed_translations.chinese: 乐意地， 欣然地； 容易地； 很快地， 立即
detailed_translations.english: quickly and easily

name: terribly
trans: Terribly means in a very bad or serious way.

sentences.english: I’m terribly sorry to have kept you waiting.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，让你久等了。

sentences.english: The coach was not terribly worried about his team’s poor performance.
sentences.chinese: 教练对他所执教球队的糟糕表现并不是十分担忧。

detailed_translations.english: very

name: unfortunately
trans: Unfortunately means regrettably or sadly.

sentences.english: Unfortunately, you were out when we called.
sentences.chinese: 很遗憾，我们来的时候你出去了。

detailed_translations.english: used when you are mentioning a fact that you wish was not true

name: forth
trans: Forth means forward in time or place.

sentences.english: The house was still burning, pouring forth thick black smoke.
sentences.chinese: 房子仍在燃烧，冒出浓浓的黑烟。

detailed_translations.english: going out from a place or point, and moving forwards or outwards

name: briefly
trans: Briefly means for a short period of time.

sentences.english: We stopped off briefly in London.
sentences.chinese: 我们在伦敦短暂停留。

detailed_translations.english: for a short time

name: moreover
trans: Moreover means in addition to what has been said.

sentences.english: The rent is reasonable and, moreover, the location is perfect.
sentences.chinese: 租金合理，而且位置也非常好。

sentences.english: The source of the information is irrelevant. Moreover, the information need not be confidential.
sentences.chinese: 信息来源无关紧要，而且也不一定必须是机密的。

detailed_translations.english: in addition – used to introduce information that adds to or supports what has previously been said

name: strongly
trans: Strongly means with great force or intensity.

sentences.english: I’m strongly opposed to capital punishment.
sentences.chinese: 我坚决反对死刑。

detailed_translations.english: in a way that is meant to persuade someone to do something

name: honestly
trans: Honestly means in an honest or truthful manner.

sentences.english: Tell me honestly, Kate, what do you think of John?
sentences.chinese: 跟我说实话，凯特，你认为约翰怎么样？

sentences.english: We talked openly and honestly.
sentences.chinese: 我们开诚布公地谈了谈。

sentences.english: ‘No, I don’t,’ she answered honestly.
sentences.chinese: “不。”她诚实地回答道。

detailed_translations.english: in an honest way

name: previously
trans: Previously means at an earlier time or before.

sentences.english: Guyana's railways were previously owned by private companies.
sentences.chinese: 圭亚那的铁路先前为私营公司所拥有。

sentences.english: The contract was awarded to a previously unknown company.
sentences.chinese: 该合同给了一家先前不知名的公司。

detailed_translations.english: Previously means at some time before the period that you are talking about

name: as
trans: As means to the same degree or in the same way.

sentences.english: I saw Peter as I was getting off the bus.
sentences.chinese: 我下公共汽车的时候看见了彼得。

sentences.english: As time passed, things seemed to get worse.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间的推移，情况似乎变得更加糟糕了。

sentences.english: Just as the two men were leaving, a message arrived.
sentences.chinese: 那两个男子刚要离开，消息就传来了。

detailed_translations.english: while or when

name: there
trans: There means in or at that place or position.

sentences.english: We could go back to my cottage and have lunch there.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以回到我的小屋去吃午饭。

sentences.english: Scotland? I’ve always wanted to go there.
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰？我一直想去那儿。

sentences.english: Hold it right there and don’t move.
sentences.chinese: 就站在那里，不要动。

sentences.english: Can you pass me that wine glass there?
sentences.chinese: 你能把那个葡萄酒杯递给我吗？

sentences.english: Look, there’s that bookshop I was telling you about.
sentences.chinese: 看，那就是我跟你说过的那家书店。

sentences.english: Who’s that man over there ?
sentences.chinese: 那边的那个男人是谁？

sentences.english: It’s too far to drive there and back in one day.
sentences.chinese: 一天开车来回太远了。

sentences.english: Are we going to get there (= arrive ) before the banks close?
sentences.chinese: 银行关门之前，我们到得了吗？

detailed_translations.chinese: 在那里；在那边；在那点上
detailed_translations.english: in or to a particular place that is not where you are
used to express satisfaction that you have been proved right or that you have done what you intended to do

name: when
trans: When means at what time or during what period.

sentences.english: When are we leaving?
sentences.chinese: 我们什么时候走？

sentences.english: When did you first meet Dr Darnall?
sentences.chinese: 你是什么时候认识达纳尔博士的？

sentences.english: When will the work be finished?
sentences.chinese: 这项工作什么时候完成？

sentences.english: I don’t know when I’ll see her again.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道何时才能再见到她。

detailed_translations.chinese: 考虑到；既然；当…时；在…时；如果
什么时候，何时；（用于时间的表达方式之后）在那时；其时；当时
detailed_translations.english: at what time

name: how
trans: How means in what way or by what means.

sentences.english: How do you spell your name?
sentences.chinese: 你的名字怎么拼写？

sentences.english: How can I help you?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么帮你？

sentences.english: I’d like to help in some way, but I’m not sure how.
sentences.chinese: 我想帮点忙，可不知道该怎么做。

sentences.english: He explained how the system worked.
sentences.chinese: 他讲解了该系统是如何运转的。

sentences.english: We both used to work at the airport – that’s how we met.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩都曾经在机场工作过，我们就是这么认识的。

sentences.english: advice on how best (= the best way ) to invest your money
sentences.chinese: 如何以最好方式进行投资的建议

sentences.english: They had a number of suggestions as to how the service could be improved.
sentences.chinese: 他们有一些关于如何改进服务的建议。

sentences.english: This still leaves the question of how local services should be funded.
sentences.chinese: 这仍然没有解决如何为地方公共服务业提供资金的问题。

sentences.english: How many kids do they have now?
sentences.chinese: 他们现在有几个孩子？

detailed_translations.english: used to ask or talk about the way in which something happens or is done

name: so
trans: So means in such a way or to such an extent.

sentences.english: The troops will not advance until ordered to do so .
sentences.chinese: 在接到命令之前，部队不会前进。

sentences.english: Did Luke sell them? And, if so , what happened to the money?
sentences.chinese: 卢克把它们卖了吗？如果是这样的话，那钱到哪里去了？

sentences.english: ‘Has he lost a fortune?’ ‘ So they say .’
sentences.chinese: “他输掉了一大笔钱吗？”“他们是这么说的。”

sentences.english: ‘Look – I’ve even cleaned the windows.’ ‘ So I see .’
sentences.chinese: “瞧，我把窗子也擦干净了。”“我看到了。”

sentences.english: Parents can withdraw their child from school if they so wish .
sentences.chinese: 家长要是愿意，可以让孩子退学。

detailed_translations.english: used to refer back to an idea, action, quality, situation etc that has just been mentioned
used to say that someone does something because of the reason just stated

name: up
trans: Up means towards a higher place or position.

sentences.english: We walked slowly up the hill.
sentences.chinese: 我们慢慢地爬上山。

sentences.english: She picked her jacket up off the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她从地板上捡起外套。

sentences.english: paths leading up into the mountains
sentences.chinese: 通往山里的小径

sentences.english: Tim had climbed up a tree to get a better view.
sentences.chinese: 蒂姆爬到了树上，以便看得更清楚。

sentences.english: Put up your hand if you know the answer.
sentences.chinese: 如果知道答案就举手。

sentences.english: The water was getting up my nose.
sentences.chinese: 水已经没到了我的鼻子。

sentences.english: Karen lay on her back, staring up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 卡伦仰卧着，盯着天花板。

sentences.english: Are you sure you should be up?
sentences.chinese: 你肯定你该起床了吗?

sentences.english: These days they were up at the crack of dawn.
sentences.chinese: 这些天他们在破晓时就起床。

detailed_translations.english: towards a higher place or position
If you are up, you are not in bed

name: out
trans: Out means away from the inside or center.

sentences.english: She opened her suitcase and took out a pair of shoes.
sentences.chinese: 她打开手提箱，拿出一双鞋。

sentences.english: Lock the door on your way out.
sentences.chinese: 你出去时把门锁上。

sentences.english: Charlotte went to the window and looked out.
sentences.chinese: 夏洛特走到窗前往外看。

sentences.english: Out you go (= used to order someone to leave a room )!
sentences.chinese: 你给我出去！

sentences.english: When the sun came out, a rainbow formed in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 太阳出来时，天空中出现了一道彩虹。

detailed_translations.english: from inside an object, container, building, or place

name: no
trans: No means not at all or not by any means.

sentences.english: ‘Are you Italian?’ ‘No, I’m Spanish.’
sentences.chinese: “你是意大利人吗？”“不，我是西班牙人。”

sentences.english: ‘Do you want any more?’ ‘No thanks.’
sentences.chinese: “你还要再来点吗？”“不要了，谢谢。”

sentences.english: ‘Could you help me write this?’ ‘No, sorry, I haven’t got time at the moment.’
sentences.chinese: “你能帮我写这个吗？”“抱歉，不行，我现在没时间。”

sentences.english: He wanted to take me to a disco but I said no.
sentences.chinese: 他想带我去迪斯科舞厅，但是我拒绝了。

sentences.english: Sixty percent of people voted no.
sentences.chinese: 60%的人投了反对票。

sentences.english: If you’re asking whether I feel the same way about her, the answer is no.
sentences.chinese: 如果你问的是我对她是否也有相同的感觉，答案是没有。

detailed_translations.english: used to give a negative reply to a question, offer, or request

name: only
trans: Only means and no one or nothing more besides.

sentences.english: Naomi was only 17 when she got married.
sentences.chinese: 娜奥米结婚时才17岁。

sentences.english: There are only a few cars on the island.
sentences.chinese: 这个岛上只有几辆汽车。

sentences.english: It’s only eight o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 才8点钟。

sentences.english: I was the only woman there.
sentences.chinese: 我是那里唯一的女性。

detailed_translations.english: not more than a particular number, age etc
used to say that there is one person, thing, or group in a particular situation and no others

name: well
trans: Well means in a good or satisfactory way.

sentences.english: Did you sleep well?
sentences.chinese: 你睡得好吗？

sentences.english: James reads quite well for his age.
sentences.chinese: 就詹姆斯的年龄来说，他的阅读能力算不错了。

sentences.english: All the team played very well today.
sentences.chinese: 今天所有队员都打得很不错。

sentences.english: Simon doesn’t work well under pressure.
sentences.chinese: 有压力时西蒙的工作表现就不好。

sentences.english: The festival was very well organized.
sentences.chinese: 节庆活动组织得很好。

sentences.english: The concert went very well.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会进行得非常顺利。

detailed_translations.chinese: 很好地；充分地；满意地；适当地
detailed_translations.english: in a successful or satisfactory way
healthy

name: then
trans: Then means at that time or subsequently.

sentences.english: I wish I had known then what I know now.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望那时我就知道现在所知道的一切。

sentences.english: It was then that I realised she’d tricked me.
sentences.chinese: 直到那时我才知道她骗了我。

sentences.english: He started his career in St Petersburg – or Leningrad as it then was.
sentences.chinese: 他在圣彼得堡——当时叫列宁格勒——开始他的事业。

sentences.english: They met in 1942 and from then on (= starting at that time ) they were firm friends.
sentences.chinese: 他们1942年认识，从那时起就一直是好朋友。

sentences.english: Silently she closed the door. Just then she heard a noise.
sentences.chinese: 她默不作声地关上了门。 就在那时，她听到有声响。

sentences.english: I was paid £1,000, which was a lot of money back then (= a long time ago when things were different ) in the 1950s.
sentences.chinese: 他们给了我1,000英镑，在20世纪50年代那可是一大笔钱。

detailed_translations.chinese: 然后；那么；于是；当时；此外
detailed_translations.english: at a particular time in the past or future

name: first
trans: First means before anything else in order or time.

sentences.english: These results are firsts in the history of women’s athletics.
sentences.chinese: 这些成绩在女运动员历史上是第一次。

sentences.english: First I had to decide what to wear.
sentences.chinese: 首先我得决定穿什么。

detailed_translations.english: 1st
at the beginning

name: where
trans: Where means in or at what place or location.

sentences.english: Where are you going?
sentences.chinese: 你要到哪儿去？

sentences.english: Where do they live?
sentences.chinese: 他们住在哪里？

sentences.english: Do you know where my glasses are?
sentences.chinese: 你知道我的眼镜在哪儿吗？

sentences.english: Where would you like to sit?
sentences.chinese: 你想坐在哪里？

detailed_translations.english: in or to which place

name: why
trans: Why means for what reason or purpose.

sentences.english: Why are you crying?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么哭？

sentences.english: Why do we have to take all these tests?
sentences.chinese: 我们为什么一定要参加这些测验？

sentences.english: ‘She wants to meet you.’ ‘Why?’
sentences.chinese: “她想认识你。”“为什么？”

sentences.english: ‘I won’t be able to come into work tomorrow.’ ‘Why not?’
sentences.chinese: “我明天不能来上班。”“为什么？”

sentences.english: I have no idea why the television isn’t working.
sentences.chinese: 我不明白电视机为什么坏了。

sentences.english: Simon loves you – that’s why he wants to be with you.
sentences.chinese: 西蒙爱你——所以他想和你在一起。

sentences.english: He’s angry with me and I don’t know why.
sentences.chinese: 他生我气了，我不知道为什么。

sentences.english: There’s no reason why we shouldn’t be friends.
sentences.chinese: 我们没有理由不成为朋友。

detailed_translations.english: used to ask or talk about the reason for something
used when you are surprised or have suddenly realized something

name: now
trans: Now means at the present time or moment.

sentences.english: She's a widow now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在是一个寡妇。

sentences.english: But we are now a much more fragmented society.
sentences.chinese: 但是我们现在是一个更加四分五裂的社会。

sentences.english: If we leave now we’ll be there before dark.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们现在出发，天黑之前就能赶到那里。

detailed_translations.english: (at) the present time

name: around
trans: Around means in a circular direction or surrounding.

sentences.english: What an inspiration she was to all around her!
sentences.chinese: 她对于她周围所有的人是一种多么大的鼓舞!

sentences.english: All those around him looked at him with amazement.
sentences.chinese: 周围的人都对他投射出惊异的眼光。

name: once
trans: Once means on one occasion or at one time.

sentences.english: I’ve only met her once.
sentences.chinese: 我只见过她一面。

sentences.english: Paul’s been to Wexford once before.
sentences.chinese: 保罗曾去过韦克斯福德一次。

detailed_translations.english: on one occasion only
from the time when something happens

name: down
trans: Down means towards or in a lower place or position.

sentences.english: David bent down to tie his shoelace.
sentences.chinese: 戴维弯腰系鞋带。

sentences.english: Get down off the table.
sentences.chinese: 从桌子上下来。

sentences.english: Tears were streaming down my face.
sentences.chinese: 我泪流满面。

sentences.english: The sun was going down and it would soon be dark.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳西下，天很快就要黑了。

sentences.english: They came running down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他们跑下楼来。

sentences.english: She stood on a balcony looking down into the courtyard.
sentences.chinese: 她站在阳台上朝下面的院子望去。

sentences.english: Glancing down the list of runners, I noticed a familiar name.
sentences.chinese: 我往下扫了一眼赛跑选手的名单，注意到了一个熟悉的名字。

sentences.english: Her hair came down to her waist.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发一直垂到腰际。

sentences.english: Ken fell asleep face down (= with his face towards the ground ) on the couch.
sentences.chinese: 肯趴在长沙发上睡着了。

sentences.english: We heard the sound of laughter down below.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到下面有笑声。

sentences.english: The bathroom is down those stairs.
sentences.chinese: 浴室在那段楼梯下面。

detailed_translations.english: to or towards a lower place or position

name: off
trans: Off means away from a place or position.

sentences.english: He got into his car and drove off.
sentences.chinese: 他上了车，随即开车走了。

sentences.english: Will someone switch the radio off?
sentences.chinese: 谁把收音机关掉好吗？

detailed_translations.english: away from a place

name: here
trans: Here means in or at this place or location.

sentences.english: What are you doing here?
sentences.chinese: 你们在这里干什么？

sentences.english: Shall we eat here?
sentences.chinese: 我们在这里吃好吗？

sentences.english: Come here for a minute.
sentences.chinese: 到这里来一下。

sentences.english: This switch here controls the lights.
sentences.chinese: 此处的这个开关控制电灯。

sentences.english: My friend here will show you the way.
sentences.chinese: 我这位朋友会给你指路的。

sentences.english: Come on. I’m over here .
sentences.chinese: 快点，我在这里。

sentences.english: Will you be back here tonight?
sentences.chinese: 今晚你回这里吗？

sentences.english: There are no good pubs round here .
sentences.chinese: 这一带没有好的酒吧。

sentences.english: Let’s settle the matter here and now .
sentences.chinese: 我们现在就解决此事吧。

detailed_translations.english: used after a verb or preposition to mean ‘in, at or to this position or place ’

name: tonight
trans: Tonight means on the present or coming evening.

sentences.english: I think I’ll go to bed early tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我想今晚我会早点上床睡觉。

sentences.english: We’re meeting him at 9 o’clock tonight.
sentences.chinese: 我们今晚9点和他见面。

detailed_translations.english: during the night of this day
the night of this day

name: away
trans: Away means at a distance from a particular place or person.

sentences.english: Go away!
sentences.chinese: 走开！

sentences.english: Dinah was crying as she drove slowly away.
sentences.chinese: 黛娜一边哭一边慢慢地开车走了。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that someone leaves a place or person, or stays some distance from a place or person

name: today
trans: Today means on the present or current day.

sentences.english: I couldn’t go shopping yesterday so I’ll have to go today.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天没能去买东西，所以今天我必须去。

sentences.english: Ed has his music lesson today.
sentences.chinese: 埃德今天有音乐课。

detailed_translations.english: on the day that is happening now
the day that is happening now

name: far
trans: Far means at, to, or by a great distance.

sentences.english: We can walk to my house from here. It isn’t far.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以从这里步行去我家，不远。

sentences.english: You could see the mountains in the far distance.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到远处的群山。

sentences.english: Since I changed jobs, I have to travel further to get to work.
sentences.chinese: 我换了工作，上班更远了。

detailed_translations.english: a long distance away
a long distance

name: quite
trans: Quite means to a considerable extent or degree.

sentences.english: I’m sorry. That’s quite impossible.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉，那是完全不可能的。

sentences.english: I felt quite bitter about it at the time.
sentences.chinese: 当时我对此感到相当痛苦。

sentences.english: Well, actually it requires quite a bit of work and research.
sentences.chinese: 呃，实际上这需要相当多的工作和研究。

sentences.english: I can see it quite clearly.
sentences.chinese: 我能清清楚楚地看见它。

detailed_translations.english: completely

name: later
trans: Later means at a time in the future or subsequently.

sentences.english: I’m going out for a bit – I’ll see you later.
sentences.chinese: 我出去一会儿——回头见。

detailed_translations.english: after the time you are talking about or after the present time

name: above
trans: Above means at a higher level or position.

sentences.english: He lived in a flat above the shop.
sentences.chinese: 他住在那商店上面的一套房间里。

sentences.english: The airliner flew above the clouds.
sentences.chinese: 大型客机在云层上面飞行。

sentences.english: The salaries we offer are well above (= much higher than ) average.
sentences.chinese: 我们提供的薪资远高于平均水平。

detailed_translations.english: in a higher position than something else

name: yet
trans: Yet means up until the present or a specified time.

sentences.english: ‘When’s your holiday?’ ‘Oh, not for ages yet.’
sentences.chinese: “你什么时候去休假？”“噢，不知何年何月呢。”

sentences.english: It could be months yet before they know their fate.
sentences.chinese: 可能要好几个月他们才能知道自己的命运。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize how much time will pass before something happens, or how long a situation will continue
used to introduce a fact, situation, or quality that is surprising after what you have just said

name: maybe
trans: Maybe means perhaps or possibly.

sentences.english: Maybe it’s all just a big misunderstanding.
sentences.chinese: 也许这只是一个很大的误会。

sentences.english: ‘Do you think he’ll come back?’ ‘Maybe.’
sentences.chinese: “你认为他会回来吗？”“也许会吧。”

sentences.english: Maybe they’re right, but maybe not .
sentences.chinese: 也许他们是对的，但也许不是。

sentences.english: You have talent, maybe even genius.
sentences.chinese: 你很有才能，甚至可以说有天赋。

sentences.english: He said he’d finish the work soon – maybe tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他说他很快就会完成那项工作——也许是明天。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something may happen or may be true but you are not certain

name: otherwise
trans: Otherwise means in a different way or under different circumstances.

sentences.english: He was tired but otherwise in good health.
sentences.chinese: 他除了累身体很好。

sentences.english: I could hear the distant noise of traffic. Otherwise all was still.
sentences.chinese: 我能听见远处车流的声音，除此之外，一切都很安静。

sentences.english: This spoiled an otherwise excellent piece of work.
sentences.chinese: 这就把本来很出色的一件作品毁掉了。

sentences.english: Their arrival livened up an otherwise dull afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 他们的到来使原本沉闷的午后活跃起来了。

detailed_translations.english: except for what has just been mentioned

name: near
trans: Near means close to or not far away from.

sentences.english: They live near London.
sentences.chinese: 他们住在伦敦附近。

sentences.english: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
sentences.chinese: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。

sentences.english: They moved house to be nearer the school.
sentences.chinese: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

sentences.english: She told the children not to go near the canal.
sentences.chinese: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。

sentences.english: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
sentences.chinese: 我警告你别再靠近！

sentences.english: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
sentences.chinese: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

detailed_translations.english: only a short distance from a person or thing
only a short distance away from someone or something

name: forward
trans: Forward means towards a destination or goal.

sentences.english: He leaned forward , his elbows resting on the table.
sentences.chinese: 他身体前倾，胳膊肘撑在桌子上。

sentences.english: The crowd surged forwards.
sentences.chinese: 人群向前涌去。

sentences.english: The next scene takes the story forward five years.
sentences.chinese: 下一个场面是描述故事中五年后的情况。

detailed_translations.english: towards a place or position that is in front of you

name: somewhere
trans: Somewhere means in or to a place not specified or known.

sentences.english: My wallet must be around here somewhere.
sentences.chinese: 我的钱包肯定是在这里的什么地方。

sentences.english: We could meet for dinner at Giorgio’s or somewhere (= or a similar place ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们可以在乔治家或别的什么地方一起吃饭。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a place, but you do not say or know exactly where

name: anywhere
trans: Anywhere means in, at, or to any place.

sentences.english: I haven't got anywhere to live.
sentences.chinese: 我没有任何地方住。

detailed_translations.english: in or to any place

name: please
trans: Please means as a polite expression of request or agreement.

sentences.english: a business that wants to please its customers
sentences.chinese: 希望让顾客满意的一家公司

sentences.english: She did everything she could to please him.
sentences.chinese: 她千方百计讨好他。

sentences.english: Most children are eager to please .
sentences.chinese: 大多数孩子都渴望取悦别人。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone happy or satisfied

name: forever
trans: Forever means for all future time; for always.

sentences.english: I wanted that moment to last forever.
sentences.chinese: 我希望那一刻成为永远。

sentences.english: Many valuable works of art were lost forever.
sentences.chinese: 许许多多珍贵的艺术品永远消失了。

sentences.english: He’s forever making comments about my weight.
sentences.chinese: 他老是议论我的体重。

detailed_translations.english: for all future time

name: somehow
trans: In a way that is not known or specified.

sentences.english: Don’t worry, we’ll get the money back somehow.
sentences.chinese: 别担心，我们总会把那些钱拿回来的。

sentences.english: Somehow, I managed to lose my keys.
sentences.chinese: 我不知怎的竟然把钥匙弄丢了。

sentences.english: Maybe we could glue it together somehow or other .
sentences.chinese: 也许我们可以想什么办法把它粘起来。

detailed_translations.chinese: 由于某种原因， 不知怎么的； 以某种方式
detailed_translations.english: in some way, or by some means, although you do not know how

name: absolutely
trans: Completely or totally.

sentences.english: ‘Do you let your kids travel alone at night?’ ‘Absolutely not!’
sentences.chinese: “你会让孩子们晚上单独外出吗？”“当然不行！”

detailed_translations.english: used when you strongly disagree with someone or when you do not want someone to do something

name: abroad
trans: In or to a foreign country or countries.

sentences.english: I’ve never lived abroad before.
sentences.chinese: 我以前从未在国外生活过。

sentences.english: She often goes abroad on business.
sentences.chinese: 她经常出国公干。

sentences.english: We never travelled abroad when we were kids.
sentences.chinese: 我们小时候从来没有去国外旅行过。

sentences.english: goods imported from abroad
sentences.chinese: 从国外进口的商品

sentences.english: The books about Harry Potter have been very popular, both at home and abroad .
sentences.chinese: 有关哈利·波特的书在国内外一直都很流行。

detailed_translations.english: in or to a foreign country

name: yeah
trans: Yes or sure.

detailed_translations.english: yes

name: nowhere
trans: Not in or to any place.

sentences.english: Nowhere is drug abuse more of a problem than in the US.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么地方的吸毒问题比美国更严重。

detailed_translations.english: not in any place or to any place

name: tomorrow
trans: On or for the day after today.

sentences.english: I’ll see you at tomorrow’s meeting.
sentences.chinese: 明天会上见。

detailed_translations.english: the day after today
on or during the day after today

name: yesterday
trans: On or for the day before today.

sentences.english: yesterday’s meeting
sentences.chinese: 昨天的会议

sentences.english: They arrived the day before yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 他们前天到的。

detailed_translations.english: the day before today
on or during the day before today

name: the
trans: Used to indicate a particular thing already mentioned or known.

sentences.english: He described the scene to me.
sentences.chinese: 他向我描述了那个情景。

sentences.english: He telegraphed me to go to the party.
sentences.chinese: 他发电报要我去参加那个聚会。

sentences.english: The world exists, whether you like it or not.
sentences.chinese: 不管你喜欢与否，这个世界照样存在。

detailed_translations.chinese: 更加（用于比较级，最高级前）
detailed_translations.english: used before two  comparative  adjectives or adverbs to show that the degree of one event or situation is related to the degree of another one

name: to
trans: Expressing motion in the direction of (a particular location).

sentences.english: The wind blew the door to.
sentences.chinese: 风把门吹上了。

detailed_translations.english: if a door is pushed to, it closes or almost closes

detailed_translations.chinese: 到；向；（表示时间、方向）朝…方向
detailed_translations.english: used to say where someone or something goes

detailed_translations.chinese: (To)人名；(柬)多；(中)脱(普通话·威妥玛)

name: in
trans: Expressing the location of someone or something inside a place or thing.

sentences.english: There’s some sugar in the cupboard.
sentences.chinese: 碗橱里有一些糖。

sentences.english: My mother was in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 我母亲在厨房里。

sentences.english: He took us for a drive in his new car.
sentences.chinese: 他开着他的新车载我们去兜风。

sentences.english: I found her sitting up in bed.
sentences.chinese: 我发现她直直地坐在床上。

sentences.english: Manson spent fifteen years in prison.
sentences.chinese: 曼森在监狱里待了15年。

sentences.english: a hole in the ground
sentences.chinese: 地上的一个洞

sentences.english: Mr Fisher is in Boston this week.
sentences.chinese: 费希尔先生本周在波士顿。

sentences.english: My parents live in New Zealand now.
sentences.chinese: 我父母现住在新西兰。

sentences.english: I never went in pubs.
sentences.chinese: 我从不进酒吧。

detailed_translations.english: used with the name of a container, place, or area to say where someone or something is

name: on
trans: Expressing the location of something at the surface of a thing.

sentences.english: I wanted to punch him on the nose.
sentences.chinese: 我真想一拳打到他鼻子上。

sentences.english: Matt kissed her on the cheek.
sentences.chinese: 马特亲吻了她的脸颊。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what part of someone or something is hit or touched

name: by
trans: Indicating the means of achieving something.

sentences.english: She stood by the window.
sentences.chinese: 她站在窗边。

sentences.english: I was attacked by a dog.
sentences.chinese: 我被一条狗袭击。

sentences.english: a church designed by the famous architect, Sir Christopher Wren
sentences.chinese: 著名建筑师克里斯托弗·雷恩爵士设计的一座教堂

sentences.english: We are all alarmed by the rise in violent crime.
sentences.chinese: 我们都对暴力罪案的增加感到忧虑。

sentences.english: interference by the state in the affairs of the Church
sentences.chinese: 国家对教会事务的干预

sentences.english: his appointment by the BBC as a producer
sentences.chinese: 英国广播公司委任他为制片人

detailed_translations.english: beside or near something

name: more
trans: To a greater extent or degree.

sentences.english: I have no more questions.
sentences.chinese: 我没问题了。

sentences.english: The film deserves more attention from the public.
sentences.chinese: 这部影片应受到公众的更多注意。

sentences.english: The accident taught him to be more careful.
sentences.chinese: 这起事故的教训使他变得更小心。

detailed_translations.english: a greater amount or number
having a particular quality to a greater degree

name: about
trans: On the subject of; concerning.

sentences.english: a book about politics
sentences.chinese: 一本有关政治的书

sentences.english: She said something about leaving town.
sentences.chinese: 她说了些要离开镇子的话。

sentences.english: He lied about his age.
sentences.chinese: 他谎报年龄。

sentences.english: About that car of yours. How much are you selling it for?
sentences.chinese: 说到你的那辆车，你打算卖什么价钱？

sentences.english: What’s he on about (=  talking about  ) ?
sentences.chinese: 他在说什么呀？

sentences.english: It’s about Tommy, doctor. He’s been sick again.
sentences.chinese: 医生，是汤米，他又病了。

sentences.english: Jo sensed fear and jealousy all about her.
sentences.chinese: 乔感觉她周围充满恐惧和嫉妒。

detailed_translations.english: concerning or relating to a particular subject

name: such
trans: Of the type previously mentioned or easily identified.

sentences.english: How dared they do such a thing?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么敢做出这样的事?

sentences.english: He would not succumb to such an item.
sentences.chinese: 他不会对这样的条款做出让步的。

detailed_translations.english: used to show that you think that something is not good enough or that there is not enough of it

name: through
trans: Moving in one side and out of the other side of (an opening, channel, or location).

sentences.english: How many working days were lost through sickness last year?
sentences.chinese: 去年因为员工生病损失了多少个工作日？

detailed_translations.english: because of something

name: new
trans: Recently made, discovered, or created.

sentences.english: the city’s new hospital
sentences.chinese: 市里新建的医院

sentences.english: the new issue of ‘Time’ magazine
sentences.chinese: 新一期《时代周刊》

sentences.english: new products on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上的新产品

sentences.english: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
sentences.chinese: 这项工作最难的地方是理解新技术。

sentences.english: a young man with new ideas
sentences.chinese: 一个有新观念的年轻人

detailed_translations.english: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc

name: just
trans: Exactly or very recently.

sentences.english: A good strong cup of coffee is just what I need right now.
sentences.chinese: 我现在正需要喝一杯浓浓的咖啡。

sentences.english: The house was large and roomy; just right for us.
sentences.chinese: 那幢房子大而宽敞，正合我们的需要。

sentences.english: She looks just like her mother.
sentences.chinese: 她看上去就像她妈妈。

sentences.english: It’s nothing serious – just a small cut.
sentences.chinese: 不要紧，只不过是个小伤口。

sentences.english: John’s just told me that he’s getting married.
sentences.chinese: 约翰刚刚告诉我他要结婚了。

detailed_translations.english: exactly

name: any
trans: Used to refer to one or some of a thing or number of things, no matter how much or how many.

sentences.english: Have you got any money?
sentences.chinese: 你身上有没有钱？

sentences.english: Any child who breaks the rules will be punished.
sentences.chinese: 凡违反规定的孩子都要受罚。

detailed_translations.english: some or even the smallest amount or number

name: each
trans: Used to refer to every one of two or more people or things.

sentences.english: They reviewed each aspect of the plan bit by bit.
sentences.chinese: 他们对计划的各个方面逐一地进行了审核。

name: much
trans: To a great extent or degree.

sentences.english: The day ended much as it began.
sentences.chinese: 这一天结束时还像开始时一样。

sentences.english: I don’t have much money with me.
sentences.chinese: 我身上没带很多钱。

detailed_translations.english: by a great amount
a large amount of something

name: before
trans: During the period of time preceding (a particular event or time).

sentences.english: The new road should be completed before the end of the year.
sentences.chinese: 这条新公路应该在年底前完工。

sentences.english: Let’s meet at our house before the show.
sentences.chinese: 看演出前在我们家碰头吧。

sentences.english: Larry arrived home before me.
sentences.chinese: 拉里在我之前到家。

sentences.english: We only got back from Scotland the day before yesterday (=  two days ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们前天才从苏格兰回来。

sentences.english: Other students joined in the protest, and before long (=  soon  ) there was a crowd of 200 or so.
sentences.chinese: 其他学生也加入了抗议队伍，不久就有200人左右了。

detailed_translations.english: earlier than something or someone

name: between
trans: At, into, or across the space separating (two objects or regions).

sentences.english: He supplements his regular meals by eating between meals.
sentences.chinese: 他在两餐之间吃点东西来补充正餐。
