sentences.english: The object of these experiments was to find the connection, if any, between the two phenomena.
sentences.chinese: 这些实验的目的就是探索这两种现象之间的联系，如果存在着任何联系的话。

name: free
trans: Without cost or payment.

sentences.english: He knew he could be free in as little as three years.
sentences.chinese: 他知道只要再过三年他就能自由了。

sentences.english: With one leap he was free!
sentences.chinese: 这一跳他就自由了！

sentences.english: He walked out of the courtroom a free man .
sentences.chinese: 他从法庭走出来，成了自由人。

sentences.english: They have called on the government to set all political prisoners free .
sentences.chinese: 他们呼吁政府释放所有政治犯。

sentences.english: He was found not guilty and walked free from the court.
sentences.chinese: 他被判无罪，当庭释放。

sentences.english: The animals are allowed to run free in the park.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物可以在公园里自由奔跑。

sentences.english: I’m free next weekend.
sentences.chinese: 下个周末我有空。

detailed_translations.english: not held, tied up, or kept somewhere as a prisoner

name: right
trans: To an exact or precise extent or degree.

sentences.english: Yes, that’s the right answer .
sentences.chinese: 对，回答正确。

sentences.english: Is that the right time ?
sentences.chinese: 那个时间对吗？

sentences.english: I got most of the questions right .
sentences.chinese: 大部分问题我都答对了。

sentences.english: His ideas have now been proved right .
sentences.chinese: 他的观点现已证明是对的。

detailed_translations.english: a statement or piece of information that is right is correct and based on true facts
exactly in a particular position or place
used to check if what you have said is correct
exactly in a particular position or place

name: best
trans: Most excellently or effectively.

sentences.english: He won the best actor award.
sentences.chinese: 他获得最佳男演员奖。

sentences.english: What’s the best way to cook this fish?
sentences.chinese: 这鱼怎么烧最好？

sentences.english: The best thing to do is to stop worrying.
sentences.chinese: 最好的办法就是不要再担心。

sentences.english: Our pilots are given the best possible training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的飞行员接受最好的训练。

sentences.english: We use only the very best ingredients.
sentences.chinese: 我们只用最好的原料。

detailed_translations.english: better than anything else or anyone else in quality, skill, how effective it is etc

name: since
trans: From a particular time or event in the past until now or a particular time in the past.

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。

sentences.english: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
sentences.chinese: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。

sentences.english: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
sentences.chinese: 她十年前离开伦敦，此后我再没有见过她。

sentences.english: The factory has been here since the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。

sentences.english: It was exactly five years since her father had died.
sentences.chinese: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。

sentences.english: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
sentences.chinese: 自从战争结束以后，已有五千多名战俘获释。

sentences.english: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
sentences.chinese: 他五年前失去工作，但此后找到了其他工作。

sentences.english: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
sentences.chinese: 我 1995 年离开学校，此后就在伦敦生活。

sentences.english: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released.
sentences.chinese: 约六千人被逮捕，不过他们中有几百人后来被释放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

detailed_translations.english: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time

name: both
trans: Used to refer to two people or things, regarded and identified together.

sentences.english: Both Helen’s parents are doctors.
sentences.chinese: 海伦的父母都是医生。

detailed_translations.english: used to talk about two people, things etc together, and emphasize that each is included

name: sure
trans: Completely confident or certain about something.

sentences.english: ‘That’s Sarah’s cousin.’ ‘Are you sure?’
sentences.chinese: “那是萨拉的表妹。”“你肯定吗？”

sentences.english: ‘What time does the show start?’ ‘I’m not sure.’
sentences.chinese: “表演什么时候开始？”“我说不准。”

sentences.english: My mother, I felt sure , had not met him before.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定我妈妈以前从未见过他。

detailed_translations.english: confident that you know something or that something is true or correct
used to say ‘yes’ to someone

name: without
trans: Not having or using.

sentences.english: After the storm we were without electricity for five days.
sentences.chinese: 暴风雨之后我们断电了五天。

sentences.english: a house without a garden
sentences.chinese: 不带花园的房子

sentences.english: We passed two ruined abbeys, one with a tower and one without.
sentences.chinese: 我们路过两座破落的寺院，一座有塔楼，另一座没有。

sentences.english: I’m getting used to managing without a car.
sentences.chinese: 我已经习惯没有汽车了。

detailed_translations.english: not having something, especially something that is basic or necessary

detailed_translations.chinese: 户外；在外面；没有或不显示某事物

name: back
trans: In or into a previous position or state.

sentences.english: I’ll be back in a minute.
sentences.chinese: 我马上回来。

sentences.english: Put that book back where you found it!
sentences.chinese: 把那本书放回原处！

sentences.english: He was back home by half past eleven.
sentences.chinese: 他是11点半之前回家的。

sentences.english: It’s possible to travel there and back in a day.
sentences.chinese: 到那里一天来回是可以的。

sentences.english: Kirov stepped back a pace.
sentences.chinese: 基洛夫往后退了一步。

detailed_translations.english: in, into, or to the place or position where someone or something was before

name: better
trans: To a greater extent or degree.

sentences.english: Your stereo is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 你的音响比我的好。

sentences.english: There must be a better way to do this.
sentences.chinese: 一定还有更好的办法来做这件事。

sentences.english: He can speak French a lot better than I can.
sentences.chinese: 他法语讲得比我好多了。

detailed_translations.english: more useful, interesting, satisfactory, effective, suitable etc
to a higher standard or quality

name: enough
trans: As much or as many as required.

sentences.english: Is there enough room for me?
sentences.chinese: 有足够的地方给我吗？

sentences.english: We didn't leave early enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们离开得不够早。

detailed_translations.english: used before plural or uncountable nouns to mean ‘as many or as much as sb needs or wants ’
to the necessary degree

name: lot
trans: A large number or amount.

sentences.english: We’ve spent a lot on the children’s education.
sentences.chinese: 我们在孩子的教育上花费甚多。

sentences.english: ‘How many CDs have you got?’ ‘Lots.’
sentences.chinese: “你有多少张CD？”“多着呢。”

sentences.english: They drew lots for the right to go first.
sentences.chinese: 他们拈阄儿决定谁先走。

detailed_translations.english: a large amount or number
to choose sb/sth by lot

name: small
trans: In a way that is limited in size or amount.

sentences.english: a small piece of paper
sentences.chinese: 一小片纸

sentences.english: a small car
sentences.chinese: 一辆小汽车

sentences.english: a small town
sentences.chinese: 小镇

sentences.english: a small dark woman
sentences.chinese: 一个皮肤黝黑的小个子女人

sentences.english: The T-shirt was too small for him.
sentences.chinese: 这件 T 恤衫他穿太小了。

sentences.english: The sweater comes in three sizes - small, medium and large.
sentences.chinese: 这羊毛衫有三个尺寸: 小号、中号和大号。

sentences.english: Only a relatively small number of people were affected.
sentences.chinese: 只有相对少数的人受到了影响。

sentences.english: a small amount of money
sentences.chinese: 一小笔钱

sentences.english: A much smaller proportion of women are employed in senior positions.
sentences.chinese: 受雇担任高级职位的女性比例要小得多。

detailed_translations.chinese: 少的，小的；微弱的；几乎没有的；不重要的；幼小的
detailed_translations.english: not large in size or amount

name: though
trans: Despite the fact that; although.

sentences.english: Two heart attacks in a year. It hasn’t stopped him smoking, though.
sentences.chinese: 一年里心脏病发作了两次，可是那也没让他把烟戒掉。

sentences.english: It sounds like a lot of fun. Isn’t it rather risky though?
sentences.chinese: 听上去很有趣。可是这不是也很危险吗？

detailed_translations.english: used after adding a fact, opinion, or question which seems surprising after what you have just said, or which makes what you have just said seem less true
used to introduce a statement that makes the main statement coming after it seem surprising, unlikely, or unexpected

name: less
trans: To a smaller extent or degree.

sentences.english: Doctors recommend eating less salt.
sentences.chinese: 医生建议少吃盐。

sentences.english: Maybe he would worry less if he understood the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他要是了解情况，也许就不会那么担心了。

sentences.english: In recent years she has appeared in public less frequently.
sentences.chinese: 近年来她在公开场合露面的次数少了。

detailed_translations.english: a smaller amount or not as much
not so much or to a smaller degree

name: little
trans: To only a small extent or degree.

sentences.english: a little house
sentences.chinese: 小屋

sentences.english: a cake decorated with little flowers
sentences.chinese: 点缀着小花的蛋糕

sentences.english: She was cutting the meat up into little bits.
sentences.chinese: 她把肉切成小丁。

sentences.english: Let me tell you a little bit about myself.
sentences.chinese: 我来给你稍微讲讲我自己吧。

sentences.english: We didn’t have toys like this when I was little.
sentences.chinese: 在我小时候，我们没有这样的玩具。

detailed_translations.english: small in size

name: under
trans: Extending or directly below something else.

sentences.english: These toys are not suitable for children under five.
sentences.chinese: 这些玩具不适合五岁以下的儿童玩。

sentences.english: Most of the events listed cost under £60.
sentences.chinese: 所列活动项目的花费大多低于 60 英镑。

sentences.english: I spend just under four hours a day seeing customers.
sentences.chinese: 我一天接待客户所花的时间将近四小时。

sentences.english: He took a deep breath before he went under.
sentences.chinese: 他在钻下水前深深地吸了口气。

detailed_translations.english: less than a particular number, amount, age, or price
Under is also an adverb

name: next
trans: Coming immediately after the present one in sequence or order.

sentences.english: The next six months will be the hardest.
sentences.chinese: 接下来的六个月将是最难熬的。

sentences.english: The man in the next chair was asleep.
sentences.chinese: 邻座的男子睡着了。

detailed_translations.english: coming straight after sb/sth in time, order or space

name: hard
trans: With a great deal of effort or force.

sentences.english: a hard wooden chair
sentences.chinese: 一把硬木椅

sentences.english: the hardest substance known to man
sentences.chinese: 已知的最硬物质

sentences.english: After months without rain, the ground was too hard to plough.
sentences.chinese: 数月无雨，土地坚硬难犁。

sentences.english: This year’s exam was much harder than last year’s.
sentences.chinese: 今年的考试比去年的难得多。

detailed_translations.english: firm, stiff, and difficult to press down, break, or cut

name: real
trans: Actually existing or happening as described or perceived.

sentences.english: She had never seen a real live elephant before.
sentences.chinese: 她以前从未见过活生生的大象。

sentences.english: a coat made of real fur
sentences.chinese: 真皮大衣

sentences.english: Things don’t happen quite that easily in real life.
sentences.chinese: 现实生活中不会动不动就有这样的事情发生。

detailed_translations.english: something that is real is actually what it seems to be and not false or artificial

name: left
trans: On or to the side of something that is considered the weaker or less important side.

sentences.english: She held out her left hand.
sentences.chinese: 她伸出左手。

sentences.english: a scar on the left side of his face
sentences.chinese: 他左脸上的伤疤

detailed_translations.english: your left side is the side of your body that contains your heart

name: least
trans: To the smallest extent or degree.

sentences.english: He's the best teacher, even though he has the least experience.
sentences.chinese: 他虽然经验最少，却是最出色的老师。

sentences.english: He’s my least favourite member of staff.
sentences.chinese: 他是最不讨我喜欢的员工。

detailed_translations.english: smallest in size, amount, degree, etc.
less than anything or anyone else

name: short
trans: In a way that does not take a long time.

sentences.english: a short meeting
sentences.chinese: 一个短会

sentences.english: Morris gave a short laugh.
sentences.chinese: 莫里斯笑了一声。

sentences.english: a short course on business English
sentences.chinese: 商业英语短期课程

sentences.english: Winter is coming and the days are getting shorter.
sentences.chinese: 冬天来临，白天变短了。

sentences.english: I’ve only been in Brisbane a short time .
sentences.chinese: 我才来布里斯班不久。

sentences.english: For a short while (= a short time ) , the city functioned as the region’s capital.
sentences.chinese: 这座城市曾经在很短的一段时间里是这个地区的首府。

sentences.english: I learned a lot during my short period as a junior reporter.
sentences.chinese: 在当初级记者的这段短暂时间里，我学到了许多。

sentences.english: Germany achieved spectacular economic success in a relatively short period of time .
sentences.chinese: 德国在相对较短的时间里取得了非凡的经济成就。

sentences.english: They met and married within a short space of time .
sentences.chinese: 他们从相识到结婚时间很短。

sentences.english: I promise to keep the meeting short and sweet (= short in a way that is good, especially not talking for a long time ) .
sentences.chinese: 我保证会议开得简短不拖拉。

sentences.english: For a few short weeks (= they seemed to pass very quickly ) the sun shone and the fields turned gold.
sentences.chinese: 短短的几个星期里，阳光照耀，田野变成了一片金黄。

detailed_translations.english: happening or continuing for only a little time or for less time than usual
a short film shown in the cinema
to almost do something but then decide not to do it

name: last
trans: On or until the final part of an event or period of time.

sentences.english: I didn’t read the last chapter of the book.
sentences.chinese: 我没有看这本书的最后一章。

sentences.english: Add the flour last.
sentences.chinese: 最后加面粉。

detailed_translations.english: happening or existing at the end, with no others after
after everything or everyone else

name: within
trans: Inside something; inside a particular area or space.

sentences.english: We should have the test results back within 24 hours.
sentences.chinese: 我们24小时之内应该可以拿到化验结果。

sentences.english: He fell sick and died within a matter of weeks.
sentences.chinese: 他病倒了，不出几星期就死了。

sentences.english: Within an hour of our arrival Caroline was starting to complain.
sentences.chinese: 我们到达还没有一小时，卡罗琳就开始抱怨了。

sentences.english: The real dangers to these rebels came from within.
sentences.chinese: 对于这些叛乱分子真正的危险来自内部。

detailed_translations.english: before a certain period of time has passed
Within is also an adverb

name: along
trans: Moving in a constant direction on (a path or route).

sentences.english: We were driving along Follyfoot Road.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着福莱福特路行驶。

sentences.english: She glanced anxiously along the line of faces.
sentences.chinese: 她焦急地扫视着这一排面孔。

sentences.english: He slid his hand along her arm.
sentences.chinese: 他的手顺着她的臂膀滑下。

sentences.english: I was driving along, thinking about Chris.
sentences.chinese: 我一边开车，一边想着克里斯。

detailed_translations.english: from one place on something such as a line, road, or edge towards the other end of it
going forward

name: lower
trans: At a lower level or rank than something.

sentences.english: Temperatures will be lower over the weekend.
sentences.chinese: 周末气温会下降。

sentences.english: She lowered her newspaper and looked around.
sentences.chinese: 她放低报纸往四下看了看。

detailed_translations.english: smaller in number or amount
to let or make sth/sb go down

name: true
trans: In accordance with fact or reality.

sentences.english: No, honestly, it’s a true story .
sentences.chinese: 不，真的，这是一个真实的故事。

sentences.english: Students decide if statements are true or false .
sentences.chinese: 由学生来判断说法正确还是错误。

sentences.english: It’s generally true to say that fewer people are needed nowadays.
sentences.chinese: 总的来说现在需要的人员少了。

sentences.english: The results appear to hold true (= still be correct ) for other countries.
sentences.chinese: 这些结果在其他国家似乎同样正确。

detailed_translations.english: based on facts and not imagined or invented

name: bad
trans: Badly is used to describe how something is done, or how someone is feeling, in a negative or unpleasant way.

sentences.english: I have some bad news for you.
sentences.chinese: 我有坏消息要告诉你。

sentences.english: I thought things couldn’t possibly get any worse.
sentences.chinese: 我想事情最坏也不过如此了。

sentences.english: The plane was delayed for several hours by bad weather.
sentences.chinese: 天气不好，飞机延误了好几个小时。

sentences.english: It’s difficult to break bad habits.
sentences.chinese: 坏习惯很难改。

sentences.english: a bad smell
sentences.chinese: 难闻的气味

detailed_translations.english: unpleasant or likely to cause problems

name: across
trans: Across means from one side of something to the other side.

sentences.english: He walked across the field.
sentences.chinese: 他走过田地。

sentences.english: There's a bank right across the street.
sentences.chinese: 街对面就有一家银行。

detailed_translations.english: from one side to the other side of sth

name: clear
trans: Clearly means something is easy to see, hear, or understand.

sentences.english: clear instructions
sentences.chinese: 明确的指示

sentences.english: The question wasn’t very clear.
sentences.chinese: 这问题不是很清楚。

sentences.english: It’s the clearest guide I’ve used.
sentences.chinese: 我从没用过这么清晰易懂的指南。

sentences.english: Perhaps I tried to cover too much and didn’t make myself clear (= express myself well ) .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我涉及的内容太多，没有表达清楚。

sentences.english: If you don’t understand, it’s best to say so and get things clear .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不明白，那就最好照直说并把事情弄清楚。

sentences.english: If I catch you smoking again, you’re grounded. Do I make myself clear (= used when you are angry ) ?
sentences.chinese: 如果再让我发现你抽烟，我就罚你不准出门。我的话你听清楚了吗？

sentences.english: Snowplows have been out clearing the roads.
sentences.chinese: 扫雪机已经出动，去清扫路面了。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a simple and direct way so that people understand
to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

name: easy
trans: Easily means without difficulty or effort.

sentences.english: The test was easy.
sentences.chinese: 考试很容易。

sentences.english: Finishing the task will not be easy.
sentences.chinese: 完成这项任务并不容易。

sentences.english: There must be an easier way to do that.
sentences.chinese: 一定有更容易的方法去做那件事。

sentences.english: instructions that are easy to follow
sentences.chinese: 易于掌握的使用说明

sentences.english: It would have been easy for the team to lose the game.
sentences.chinese: 球队本来是很容易会输掉这场比赛的。

sentences.english: Having you here does make things a lot easier for me.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，有你在这里事情的确好办多了。

sentences.english: On the whole, Dad has had an easy life.
sentences.chinese: 总而言之，爸爸过着安逸舒适的生活。

sentences.english: You can have an easy time of it now that the kids have all left home.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们都离开了家，你日子可以过得轻松了。

detailed_translations.english: not difficult to do, and not needing much effort

name: full
trans: Fully means completely or to the greatest extent possible.

sentences.english: The train was completely full.
sentences.chinese: 火车坐得满满的。

sentences.english: Don’t talk with your mouth full.
sentences.chinese: 嘴里塞满东西时不要说话。

sentences.english: The class is full, but you can register for next term.
sentences.chinese: 这个班已经满了，不过你可以注册下学期的。

sentences.english: The Health Centre offers a full range of services.
sentences.chinese: 医疗中心提供全套服务。

detailed_translations.english: containing as much or as many things or people as possible, so there is no space left

name: close
trans: Closely means in a way that is near in space, time, or relationship.

sentences.english: Would you mind if I closed the window?
sentences.chinese: 我把窗户关上你不介意吧？

sentences.english: She closed the curtains.
sentences.chinese: 她拉上了窗帘。

sentences.english: Let me do the car door – it won’t close properly.
sentences.chinese: 我来修一下车门，它关不紧。

sentences.english: Beth closed her eyes and tried to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 贝丝合上眼睛想睡觉。

sentences.english: She heard the door close behind her.
sentences.chinese: 她听见门在她身后关上了。

sentences.english: I will now close the meeting by asking you to join me in a final toast.
sentences.chinese: 现在我要请大家最后干一杯来结束这次会议。

detailed_translations.english: to shut something in order to cover an opening, or to become shut in this way

name: late
trans: Lately means not on time, or after the expected or usual time.

sentences.english: Sorry I’m late – I overslept.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，来晚了——我睡过头了。

sentences.english: The train was even later than usual.
sentences.chinese: 火车到得甚至比平时还晚。

sentences.english: We apologize for the late departure of flight AZ709.
sentences.chinese: 我们为AZ709航班延误起飞表示歉意。

sentences.english: There are penalties if loan repayments are late.
sentences.chinese: 逾期偿还贷款会被处以罚金。

sentences.english: The stores are open later on Thursdays.
sentences.chinese: 商店星期四开门较晚。

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or done after the time that was expected, agreed, or arranged
after the usual time

name: proper
trans: Properly means in the right or appropriate way.

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

name: fast
trans: Fast means quickly or at a high speed.

sentences.english: a fast car
sentences.chinese: 速度很快的汽车

sentences.english: That can’t be the time - my watch must be fast.
sentences.chinese: 不可能是这个时间——一定是我的表快了。

sentences.english: Slow down – you’re driving too fast.
sentences.chinese: 慢点——你开得太快了。

detailed_translations.english: moving or able to move quickly
moving quickly

name: wide
trans: Widely means over a large area or range.

sentences.english: a man with a wide experience of foreign affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交事务经验丰富的人

sentences.english: Our aim is to bring classical music to a wider audience.
sentences.chinese: 我们的目的是把古典音乐带给更多的听众。

detailed_translations.chinese: 广泛的；宽的，广阔的；张大的；远离目标的
detailed_translations.english: including or involving a large variety of different people, things, or situations
opening or spreading as much as possible

name: item
trans: An item refers to a particular thing or object.

sentences.english: He opened the cardboard box and took out each item.
sentences.chinese: 他打开纸板箱把里面的物品一一拿出来。

sentences.english: The store is having a sale on furniture and household items.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店正在减价出售家具和家居用品。

sentences.english: luxury items such as exotic spices and perfumes
sentences.chinese: 异国香料和香水之类的奢侈品

sentences.english: The original 1965 bottle is now a collector’s item (= one of a set of objects people like to collect because they are interesting or valuable ).
sentences.chinese: 这瓶1965年生产的原装酒现在是收藏品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 〔尤指清单上、一群或一组事物中的〕一项，一件，一条
detailed_translations.english: a single thing, especially one thing in a list, group, or set of things

name: wrong
trans: Wrongly means in a way that is not correct or accurate.

sentences.english: You’ve spelt my name wrong.
sentences.chinese: 你把我的名字拼错了。

sentences.english: What? Have I done it wrong ?
sentences.chinese: 什么？我做得不对吗？

sentences.english: I asked him to sort those files, but he’s done it all wrong (= in completely the wrong way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我让他整理这些文件，可是他弄得根本不对。

sentences.english: I must have added it up wrong, then.
sentences.chinese: 那我一定是加错了。

sentences.english: It looks like it's spelled wrong.
sentences.chinese: 看起来像是拼错了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误地；邪恶地，不正当地
detailed_translations.english: not in the correct way
behaviour that is not morally right

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误的；失常的；不适当的
detailed_translations.english: not correct, and not based on true facts
Wrong is also an adverb

name: ago
trans: Ago means in the past or before the present time.

sentences.english: They moved to a new house some time ago (=  a fairly long time ago  ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们搬进新居已有些日子了。

sentences.english: We had our bicentenary celebrations not that long ago.
sentences.chinese: 不久前，我们举行了200周年庆典活动。

detailed_translations.english: used to show how far back in the past something happened

name: behind
trans: Behind means at the back of or in the rear of something.

sentences.english: I turned to speak to the person standing behind me.
sentences.chinese: 我转身和站在我后面的那人说话。

sentences.english: Someone could easily creep up behind us.
sentences.chinese: 很可能有人跟在我们后面。

sentences.english: The car behind was hooting impatiently.
sentences.chinese: 后面那辆车不耐烦地按着喇叭。

sentences.english: Jane shut the door behind her.
sentences.chinese: 简随手关上身后的门。

sentences.english: The manager was sitting behind a large desk.
sentences.chinese: 经理坐在一张大办公桌的后面。

detailed_translations.english: at or towards the back of a thing or person

name: quick
trans: Quickly means in a short amount of time or without delay.

sentences.english: That was quick! I thought you’d be another hour.
sentences.chinese: 很快啊！我以为你还要一个小时呢。

sentences.english: It’s probably quicker by train.
sentences.chinese: 乘火车可能会快一点。

sentences.english: Have we got time for a quick drink?
sentences.chinese: 我们有时间喝口东西吗？

sentences.english: What’s the quickest way to the station?
sentences.chinese: 到车站怎么走最快？

sentences.english: We stopped to have a quick look at the church.
sentences.chinese: 我们停下来迅速地扫了一眼教堂。

sentences.english: Three bombs went off in quick succession (= quickly, one after the other ).
sentences.chinese: 瞬间有三个炸弹连续爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: lasting for or taking only a short time

name: straight
trans: Straight means without bending or curving, or in a direct and honest way.

sentences.english: a long, straight road
sentences.chinese: 一条笔直的长路

sentences.english: Try to keep your legs straight.
sentences.chinese: 尽量把腿伸直。

sentences.english: Always lift with a straight back.
sentences.chinese: 提东西的时候，一定要把背挺直。

sentences.english: her long, straight black hair
sentences.chinese: 她又长又直的黑发

sentences.english: They sat down in a straight line .
sentences.chinese: 他们坐成一直溜儿。

sentences.english: The road was dead straight (= completely straight ) .
sentences.chinese: 那条路是笔直的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 直的；连续的；笔直的；正直的；整齐的；异性恋的
detailed_translations.english: something that is straight does not bend or curve

detailed_translations.chinese: 直接地；不断地；立即；坦率地
detailed_translations.english: in a level or correct position

detailed_translations.chinese: 直；直线；直男，直女，异性恋者
detailed_translations.english: the straight part of a  racetrack

name: direct
trans: Directly means in a straight line or without intervening factors.

sentences.english: Experienced users have direct access to the main data files.
sentences.chinese: 高级用户可直接浏览主数据文档。

sentences.english: I’m not in direct contact with them.
sentences.chinese: 我和他们没有直接的联系。

sentences.english: Few policy-makers have had direct experience of business.
sentences.chinese: 决策者几乎都没有直接的从商经历。

sentences.english: Women often feel men are too direct and not sympathetic enough.
sentences.chinese: 女人常常觉得男人太直率，不够体贴。

detailed_translations.english: done without any other people, actions, processes etc coming between

name: extra
trans: Extra means in addition to what is usual or expected.

sentences.english: Could you get an extra loaf of bread?
sentences.chinese: 你能多拿一条面包吗？

sentences.english: Allow extra time for your journey.
sentences.chinese: 要给你的旅程多留出点时间。

sentences.english: Drivers are advised to take extra care.
sentences.chinese: 建议司机开车要格外小心。

sentences.english: You’re going to have to work extra hard to pass the exam.
sentences.chinese: 你要格外用功才能通过考试。

detailed_translations.english: more of something, in addition to the usual or standard amount or number
used to emphasize an adjective or adverb

name: morning
trans: In the morning means during the early part of the day, from sunrise until noon.

sentences.english: I hated those cold winter mornings.
sentences.chinese: 我讨厌冬天里寒冷的早晨。

sentences.english: I’m not feeling very well this morning.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上我觉得不大舒服。

sentences.english: He stayed in bed late on Sunday morning.
sentences.chinese: 星期日早上他睡到很晚。

sentences.english: She took the early morning train.
sentences.chinese: 她搭乘了一大早的火车。

detailed_translations.english: the early part of the day, from when the sun rises until 12 o’clock in the middle of the day

name: pretty
trans: Pretty means attractive or pleasing to look at.

sentences.english: a pretty little girl
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的小姑娘

sentences.english: Maria looks much prettier with her hair cut short.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚把头发剪短好看多了。

detailed_translations.english: a woman or child who is pretty has a nice attractive face

name: overall
trans: Overall means taking everything into account or in general.

sentences.english: The overall cost of the exhibition was £400,000.
sentences.chinese: 展览会的全部费用是40万英镑。

sentences.english: The overall result is an increase in population.
sentences.chinese: 总的结果是人口增加。

sentences.english: An overall winner and a runner-up were chosen.
sentences.chinese: 总冠军和第二名被选了出来。

sentences.english: We don’t want all the details now, just the overall picture.
sentences.chinese: 现在我们不需要全部细节，只要知道大致的情况。

detailed_translations.english: heavy cotton trousers with a piece covering your chest, held up by pieces of cloth that go over your shoulders
considering or including everything

name: alone
trans: Alone means without anyone else or being solitary.

sentences.english: She lives alone.
sentences.chinese: 她一个人生活。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t leave a child alone in the house.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把小孩独自留在家里。

sentences.english: My wife and I like to spend time alone together away from the kids.
sentences.chinese: 我和妻子喜欢没有孩子打扰，过二人世界。

sentences.english: She has lived alone in this house for almost five years now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在已经独自在这所房子里住了差不多五年了。

detailed_translations.english: if you are alone in a place, there is no one with you
without any help from other people

name: bright
trans: Brightly means giving out a lot of light or shining strongly.

sentences.english: Her eyes were hurting from the bright lights.
sentences.chinese: 明亮的光线刺痛了她的眼睛。

sentences.english: bright sunshine
sentences.chinese: 灿烂的阳光

sentences.english: a large bright room
sentences.chinese: 明亮的大房间

sentences.english: He was an exceptionally bright child.
sentences.chinese: 他是个特别聪明的孩子。

detailed_translations.english: shining strongly, or with plenty of light

name: flat
trans: Flatly means without any emotion or enthusiasm.

sentences.english: The bed can be folded flat for storage.
sentences.chinese: 这张床可以折扁存放。

sentences.english: He lay flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他平躺在地板上。

sentences.english: That night I lay flat on my back and stared up at the ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 那一夜，我仰面平躺，眼睛直直地盯着天花板。

detailed_translations.chinese: 平直地； 直截了当地
detailed_translations.english: in a position in which the surface of something is against another surface without curving or sloping

detailed_translations.chinese: 平的；固定的；漏气的；单调的，沉闷的；浅的
detailed_translations.english: smooth and level, without raised or hollow areas, and not sloping or curving
a place for people to live that consists of a set of rooms that are part of a larger building

name: whatever
trans: Whatever means anything or everything that.

sentences.english: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.
sentences.chinese: 凡是与科学有关的她都没有表现出任何兴趣。

sentences.english: This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一场无聊的争论，和你的工作没有任何关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: [用于否定句中以加强语气]任何； 无论什么
detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a negative statement

name: slow
trans: Slowly means at a low speed or taking a long time.

sentences.english: The car was travelling at a very slow speed.
sentences.chinese: 汽车正以非常慢的速度行驶。

sentences.english: a slow walker
sentences.chinese: 慢慢走着的人

sentences.english: The economy faces a year of slower growth.
sentences.chinese: 经济将面临增长更缓慢的一年。

sentences.english: Take a few deep, slow breaths.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢地深吸几口气。

sentences.english: I began to walk slower and slower.
sentences.chinese: 我开始走得越来越慢。

detailed_translations.english: not moving, being done, or happening quickly
In informal English, slower is used to mean "at a slower speed" and slowest is used to mean "at the slowest speed." In nonstandard English, slow is used to mean "with little speed."

name: clean
trans: Cleanly means in a way that is free from dirt, marks, or unwanted substances.

sentences.english: Are your hands clean?
sentences.chinese: 你的手干净吗？

sentences.english: clean towels
sentences.chinese: 干净的毛巾

sentences.english: Make sure you keep the wound clean .
sentences.chinese: 一定要保持伤口清洁。

sentences.english: Wipe that sink clean when you’re done.
sentences.chinese: 洗完后将水槽擦干净。

sentences.english: As usual, she left her room clean and tidy before going to school.
sentences.chinese: 和往常一样，她去上学之前把房间收拾得干干净净。

sentences.english: a spotlessly clean kitchen
sentences.chinese: 一尘不染的厨房

sentences.english: Oh, don’t get mad - it’s just good clean fun !
sentences.chinese: 噢，不要生气——这不过是个正经的玩笑嘛！

detailed_translations.english: without any dirt, marks etc

name: fresh
trans: Freshly means recently or newly.

sentences.english: I’ll just make some fresh coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我来重新煮点咖啡。

sentences.english: The report provides fresh evidence about the way the business was run.
sentences.chinese: 报告提供了有关该公司运营方式的新证据。

sentences.english: You’ll have to start again on a fresh sheet of paper.
sentences.chinese: 你得拿张新的纸重新开始。

sentences.english: The beans are fresh from the garden.
sentences.chinese: 这些豆子是刚从园子里摘来的。

detailed_translations.english: adding to or replacing something

name: whenever
trans: Whenever means at any time or every time that.

sentences.english: They were always there by you， whenever you needed them.
sentences.chinese: 无论何时你需要他们，他们总是在你身边。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不论何时；随便什么时候
detailed_translations.english: at any time

name: cheap
trans: Cheaply means at a low cost or price.

sentences.english: cheap rail fares
sentences.chinese: 便宜的火车票

sentences.english: the cheapest TV on the market
sentences.chinese: 市场上最便宜的电视机

sentences.english: Property is cheaper in Spain than here.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙的房地产比这里便宜。

sentences.english: a cheap shop (= one that sells goods cheaply )
sentences.chinese: 廉价商店

sentences.english: The equipment is relatively cheap and simple to use.
sentences.chinese: 这种设备相对比较便宜，而且操作简单。

sentences.english: Cheap wine gives me a headache.
sentences.chinese: 我喝劣质的葡萄酒会头痛。

detailed_translations.english: not at all expensive, or lower in price than you expected

name: thin
trans: Thinly means in a way that is not thick or with very little substance.

sentences.english: a thin gold chain
sentences.chinese: 一条细细的金链

sentences.english: She’s only wearing a thin summer jacket (= a jacket made of light material ) .
sentences.chinese: 她只穿了一件薄薄的夏装外套。

sentences.english: two thin slices of bread
sentences.chinese: 薄薄的两片面包

sentences.english: The road was covered with a thin layer of ice.
sentences.chinese: 路面上覆盖着一层薄薄的冰。

sentences.english: The skin on the eyelids is the thinnest on the body.
sentences.chinese: 眼睑上的皮肤是人体最薄的皮肤。

sentences.english: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.chinese: 北约将继续裁军。

sentences.english: NATO will continue to thin out its forces.
sentences.chinese: 北约将继续裁军。

detailed_translations.chinese: 薄的；瘦的；稀薄的；微弱的
detailed_translations.english: if something is thin, there is only a small distance between its two opposite sides or surfaces
Thin out means the same as
Thin out means the same as

name: cool
trans: Coolly means in a calm and composed way or without showing much emotion.

sentences.english: She swam out into the cool water.
sentences.chinese: 她往外游向清凉的水里。

sentences.english: The evening air was cool.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚的空气很凉爽。

sentences.english: Relax in the sun with a cool drink.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光下喝杯清凉饮料放松一下。

sentences.english: the cooler weather of September
sentences.chinese: 九月较凉爽的天气

detailed_translations.english: low in temperature, but not cold, often in a way that feels pleasant
to make something slightly colder, or to become slightly colder
a temperature that is pleasantly cold
used to tell someone to stop being angry, violent etc

name: fair
trans: Fairly means in a way that is just, reasonable, or without bias.

sentences.english: a fair maiden
sentences.chinese: 美丽的少女

detailed_translations.english: pleasant and attractive

name: fine
trans: Finely means in a way that is delicate, subtle, or precise.

sentences.english: Many people regard Beethoven’s fifth symphony as his finest work.
sentences.chinese: 很多人认为贝多芬的第五交响曲是他最杰出的作品。

sentences.english: He’s a very fine player.
sentences.chinese: 他是个很优秀的选手。

sentences.english: It’s a fine idea.
sentences.chinese: 这是个很妙的主意。

sentences.english: Hatfield House is a fine example of Jacobean architecture.
sentences.chinese: 哈特菲尔德宅第是英王詹姆斯一世时期建筑的典范。

sentences.english: The restaurant was chosen for its good food and fine wines .
sentences.chinese: 这家餐厅因其美酒佳肴而入选。

detailed_translations.english: very good or of a very high standard

name: smooth
trans: Smoothly means in a way that is without any roughness, bumps, or irregularities.

sentences.english: Her skin felt smooth and cool.
sentences.chinese: 她的皮肤摸上去又滑又凉。

sentences.english: a smooth pebble
sentences.chinese: 光滑的卵石

sentences.english: The stone steps had been worn smooth .
sentences.chinese: 石阶被磨得光溜溜的了。

sentences.english: She stood up and smoothed down her frock.
sentences.chinese: 她站了起来，抚平了自己的连衣裙。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth surface has no rough parts, lumps, or holes, especially in a way that is pleasant and attractive to touch

detailed_translations.chinese: 使光滑；消除（障碍等）；使优雅；缓和
detailed_translations.english: to make a rough surface flat and even
If you smooth something, you move your hands over its surface to make it smooth and flat

name: false
trans: Falsely means in a way that is not true or accurate.

sentences.english: I don’t want to give you any false hopes .
sentences.chinese: 我不想让你有任何虚假的希望。

sentences.english: The statement gives us a false impression that we understand something when we do not.
sentences.chinese: 这句话使我们产生错觉，以为自己懂了，但其实并没懂。

sentences.english: false assumptions about people of other cultures
sentences.chinese: 对来自其他文化的人的错误假设

sentences.english: {"GLOSS":["a feeling of being safe when you are not really safe"],"COLLOINEXA":["a false sense of security"]}
sentences.chinese: 虚假的安全感

detailed_translations.english: based on incorrect information or ideas

name: thick
trans: Thickly means in a way that is not thin or with a lot of substance.

sentences.english: a thick oak door
sentences.chinese: 一扇厚实的橡木门

sentences.english: a thick slice of homemade bread
sentences.chinese: 一片厚厚的自制面包

sentences.english: He was wearing thick glasses.
sentences.chinese: 他戴着厚厚的眼镜。

sentences.english: short thick fingers
sentences.chinese: 短粗的手指

sentences.english: thick wool socks (= socks that are heavy and warm )
sentences.chinese: 厚厚的羊毛袜子

sentences.english: If you want a thicker blanket, there are more here in the closet.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想要更厚的毯子，这个柜子里还有。

sentences.english: The meat is done when the thickest part turns from pink to white.
sentences.chinese: 肉最厚的部分从粉红色变成白色，就说明熟了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is thick, there is a large distance or a larger distance than usual between its two opposite surfaces or sides

name: collect
trans: Collectively means as a group or as a whole.

sentences.english: After 25 years of collecting recipes, she has compiled them into a cookbook.
sentences.chinese: 她搜集了25年食谱，把它们编成一本烹饪书。

sentences.english: The company collects information about consumer trends.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司搜集有关消费者趋向的信息。

sentences.english: We’ve been out collecting signatures for our petition.
sentences.chinese: 我们出去为我们的请愿征集签名。

detailed_translations.english: to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together
to get things of the same type from different places and bring them together

name: nearby
trans: Nearby means in the vicinity or close to a particular place.

sentences.english: Lucy was staying in the nearby town of Hamilton.
sentences.chinese: 露西当时住在附近的汉密尔顿镇。

sentences.english: He might easily have been seen by someone who lived nearby.
sentences.chinese: 他可能很容易被住在附近的人看到。

sentences.english: The helicopter crashed to earth nearby.
sentences.chinese: 直升机坠毁在附近的地面上。

detailed_translations.english: not far away
a short distance from sb/sth; not far away

name: wild
trans: Wildly means in a way that is uncontrolled or with great enthusiasm.

sentences.english: {"COLLOINEXA":["wild animals"]}
sentences.chinese: 野生动物

sentences.english: a field full of wild flowers
sentences.chinese: 遍地野花的田野

sentences.english: animals both wild and domesticated
sentences.chinese: 野生动物和家养动物

detailed_translations.chinese: 野生的；野蛮的；狂热的；荒凉的
detailed_translations.english: living in a natural state, not changed or controlled by people
in natural and free conditions, not kept or controlled by people
if plants run wild, they grow a lot in an uncontrolled way

name: apart
trans: Apart means separated by a distance or interval.

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

name: none
trans: None means not any or not one.

sentences.english: I wish I could offer you some cake but there’s none left.
sentences.chinese: 我真想能请你吃些蛋糕，但一点也没剩的了。

sentences.english: Although these were good students, none had a score above 60.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这些都是好学生，但是没有一个考到60分以上。

sentences.english: She waited for a reply, but none came.
sentences.chinese: 她等着答复，可是什么也没等到。

sentences.english: Even an old car is better than none.
sentences.chinese: 有一辆旧车也比没有车强。

sentences.english: I was none too pleased to have to take the exam again.
sentences.chinese: 我要重考一次，根本高兴不起来。

detailed_translations.english: not any amount of something or not one of a group of people or things
not at all

name: strange
trans: Strangely means in a way that is unusual, surprising, or difficult to understand.

sentences.english: a strange city
sentences.chinese: 陌生的城市

sentences.english: strange noises
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的噪声

sentences.english: Does Geoff’s behaviour seem strange to you?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得杰夫的行为反常吗？

sentences.english: She felt there was something strange about Dexter’s voice.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得德克斯特的声音有点奇怪。

sentences.english: Isn’t it strange how animals seem to sense danger?
sentences.chinese: 动物似乎能感觉到危险，这不是很奇怪吗？

sentences.english: It’s strange that we’ve never met before.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪，我们以前居然从来没有碰见过。

sentences.english: For some strange reason, I slept like a baby despite the noise.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪，不知为什么，尽管很吵闹，但我仍睡得很香。

sentences.english: Strange as it may seem, I actually prefer cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 听上去也许很奇怪，我竟然喜欢冷天。

sentences.english: That’s strange. I was sure Jude was right here a second ago.
sentences.chinese: 真奇怪，我肯定祖德刚刚还在这儿的。

sentences.english: The strange thing is all four victims had red hair.
sentences.chinese: 令人奇怪的是，四名受害者都是红头发的。

detailed_translations.english: not familiar because you have not been there before or met the person before

name: tourist
trans: Touristically means in a way that is related to tourism or the tourist industry.

sentences.english: Cambridge is always full of tourists in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 剑桥在夏季总是挤满了游客。

sentences.english: The Statue of Liberty is a major tourist attraction .
sentences.chinese: 自由女神像是主要的旅游景点。

sentences.english: What effect will this have on the local tourist industry ?
sentences.chinese: 这对当地的旅游业会有什么影响？

detailed_translations.english: someone who is visiting a place for pleasure on holiday

name: aside
trans: Aside means to one side or out of the way.

sentences.english: He pushed his half-eaten salad aside and left.
sentences.chinese: 他推开吃了一半的色拉走了。

sentences.english: He stepped aside to let Katherine go in first.
sentences.chinese: 他站到一边让凯瑟琳先进去。

sentences.english: Mark drew me aside and explained the problem.
sentences.chinese: 马克把我拉到一边给我解释这个问题。

sentences.english: She swept her thick hair aside.
sentences.chinese: 她把浓密的头发梳到一边。

detailed_translations.english: moved to one side or away from you

name: loud
trans: Loudly means with a high volume or in a way that can be easily heard.

sentences.english: The book fell to the floor with a loud bang.
sentences.chinese: 书砰的一声掉落到地上。

sentences.english: The music was so loud that I had to shout.
sentences.chinese: 音乐太响了，我只得大声地喊。

sentences.english: ‘Who’s there?’ asked David in a loud voice.
sentences.chinese: “是谁？” 戴维大声问道。

detailed_translations.english: making a lot of noise

name: super
trans: Super means to an extremely high degree or level.

sentences.english: an old car in super condition
sentences.chinese: 一辆状况极好的旧车

sentences.english: That sounds super.
sentences.chinese: 那听起来棒极了。

sentences.english: What a super idea!
sentences.chinese: 这个主意太妙了！

detailed_translations.english: extremely good

detailed_translations.chinese: 特级品，特大号；临时雇员

name: tight
trans: Tightly means in a way that is firmly or closely fixed in place.

sentences.english: tight jeans
sentences.chinese: 紧身牛仔裤

sentences.english: My shoes were so tight that I could hardly walk.
sentences.chinese: 鞋子很紧，我几乎不能走路。

sentences.english: The jacket is rather a tight fit (= it fits too tightly ) .
sentences.chinese: 这件夹克衫太紧了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 紧的；密封的；绷紧的；麻烦的；严厉的；没空的；吝啬的
detailed_translations.english: tight clothes fit your body very closely, especially in a way that is uncomfortable
very firmly or closely

name: gross
trans: Grossly means in a way that is extremely unpleasant or offensive.

sentences.english: He abused the Admiral in the grossest terms.
sentences.chinese: 他用最粗俗的字眼辱骂那位海军上将。

detailed_translations.english: If you say that someone's speech or behaviour is gross, you think it is very coarse, vulgar, or unacceptable

name: ill
trans: Ill means in a way that is not healthy or suffering from a disease or illness.

sentences.english: Bridget can’t come – she’s ill.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特不能来了，她生病了。

sentences.english: He was unable to join the army because of ill health.
sentences.chinese: 他因为身体不好没法参军。

sentences.english: The animals had been grossly ill-treated.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物受到了恣意虐待。

detailed_translations.english: suffering from a disease or not feeling well
badly or in an unpleasant way

name: downtown
trans: Downtown means in or towards the central part of a city or town.

sentences.english: By day he worked downtown for American Standard.
sentences.chinese: 白天，他在市中心为美国标准公司工作。

sentences.english: ...an office in downtown Chicago.
sentences.chinese: …芝加哥市中心的一间办公室。

sentences.english: ...in a large vacant area of the downtown.
sentences.chinese: …在市中心的一大块空地上。

detailed_translations.english: Downtown is also an adverb
Downtown places are in or toward the centre of a large town or city, where the stores and places of business are
Downtown is also a noun

name: honest
trans: Honestly means in a way that is truthful or sincere.

sentences.english: He was a hard-working, honest man.
sentences.chinese: 他勤奋老实。

sentences.english: Ann had an honest face.
sentences.chinese: 安有一张诚实的面孔。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is honest always tells the truth and does not cheat or steal

name: ok
trans: Okay means in a way that is acceptable or satisfactory.

name: pray
trans: Pray means in a way that is related to religious worship or asking for help from a higher power.

sentences.english: They went to the mosque to pray.
sentences.chinese: 他们去清真寺祷告。

detailed_translations.english: to speak to God in order to ask for help or give thanks

name: weekly
trans: Weekly means happening or done once a week.

sentences.english: The group meets weekly.
sentences.chinese: 小组每周见面一次。

detailed_translations.english: Weekly is also an adverb
happening or done every week
